text: Should have trusted the 2-star yelp review & tried another place at Westgate. We went here to grab a bite before an event at Jobing.com arena. There was no wait & we sat down outside. We ordered beers which were $6 and $7 a pint. We asked about HH while I turned around & read the sign saying HH from 4-7sign. They took it down after explaining there weren't any specials. The fact that there was an "event" meant NO happy hour specials.... Zip, zero, none! Really you can't have even one beer on special? Lame.  Wing orders have to be ALL one flavor & you get 8. You can't get two "flavors". I guess that would be too complicated. A bit later we ordered a burger & a club sandwich. I kid you not, they came out in under 2 minutes! Obviously not made fresh for "our" order... Big disappointment. And even though the menu reads, "all burgers cooked to medium" it was well done.  Honestly the soft pretzel twist & the chocolate dessert stand inside the venue concession area looked better than what we ate at McFadden's. We won't be going back to this joint. If you don't have drink specials your food better be darn good...

I'd give this place NEGATIVE stars.  Waited in line for a seat for about 15 mins-understandable, it's right by a stadium. Waited for our order to be taken & delivered-again, understandable it was busy. Food was about Applebee's quality on a bad day.  No ketchup, no napkins, no utensils-no service or ran by without noticing my flag down.  I grabbed my own ketchup and napkins. Proceeded to get scolded by the manager for getting our own napkins.   Poor service, mediocre food.

Disclaimer: I do not party. I do not club. I no longer frequent establishments with the intent to get drunk and kiss men many years my senior. Those days are long gone, and this review reflects a chaste,  Labor Day lunch experience. No one peed their pants, or vomited $2 well drinks into the fountains outside. Be forewarned.   My boyfriend decided that he wanted to take me to Cabela's...not because I am a camper or outdoorsy girl, but because I have a love for all things elaborately themed. After traipsing through a delightful faux wilderness of guns and taxidermied animals, we were famished and ready to go just about anywhere to eat just about anything. We ventured across the street to Westgate, and McFadden's is where we happened to end up.  We walked in, and the place was just about empty. A courteous -  if a bit disconnected - hostess seated us at a table for two with big, comfy leather armchairs. Soon after, we ordered some nondescript beverages and surveyed the scene. Pretty classy interior for something set up like a sports bar/grill combo. No complaints about the atmosphere...lots of TVs, if that's your thing. "If that's your thing"...I use that phrase a lot in reviews. It's annoying. Sorry!  My boyfriend ordered the Pit Burger, and I ordered the Turkey Club. I can't speak for the millieu in the evenings, but we found the restaurant during the day to be very conducive to conversation, and enjoyed ourselves while we waited for our food. My Turkey Club was incredibly delicious...like, I want to eat another one. Right now. The fries were great...they are seasoned, but the menu doesn't tell you that. My boyfriend loved his burger, and the mashed potatoes he got to go with it...but I found them to be a little flavorless, and too buttery.   It's not a cool, hipster-points-hole-in-the-wall place, and nothing about it was special or gimmicky, but the food really was excellent for being something simple and unpretentious. Just regular lunch fare, at good prices and in a pleasing environment. The staff, as I mentioned before, was friendly enough, if a bit restrained. I wouldn't tell you to go out of your way to try it, and it really should be 3 stars, but that Turkey Club is still on my mind. Mmm.

Arrived at Midnight on a Thursday to have some martinis with my girlfriend. Bartenders were very nice however the bouncer (short black guy) was extremely rude. Music selection was really good and the drinks were decent. It was 12:45 and they called out last call so we ordered a martini. 15 minutes later the bouncer starts trying to kick us out. He was super rude and said that if we don't chug our drinks he would take them away. I did not appreciate his behavior due to the fact that you enjoy a martini not chug it. I was planning to celebrate birthday here but I will be taking it elsewhere. If you want people to drink in your establishment don't kick them out when they just ordered a drink.

This place is terrible. We were here for the super bowl and paid a ton for the "privilege" to have a table for 8. Despite having that coveted reservation we still had to wait in line for over an hour. They clearly had no clue how to manage a crowd and provided a buffet for the $200 per person that was full of crappy choices. I would NEVER come here again. Do yourself a favor and stay away. The only reason they deserve one star (besides the fact I can't give zero) is that they have plenty of TVs- lots of places have those though, most likely your home included, so do yourself a favor and stay there.

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD!  Everything started out alright, our server Alayna was nice and did a fine job.  Then came the rude comments and trash talk from the other members of the wait staff.  This happened several times in the hour or so we were there.  When I'm a visiting football fan in another city I expect to hear it from opposing fans, but not from the wait staff at a place where I'm a paying customer.  I found it uncalled for and completely unprofessional.  Never done this before, but thought it was worth mentioning to management.  When we mentioned it to the "GM", Joe Keefe, he denied it ever happening and told us we were wrong.  Seriously, why would any of us lie about something like that!?!  I was appalled at his incompetency as a "GM".  All he had to do was acknowledge the problem and and take care of it.  Instead, he called us liars.  Then he had the nerve to try and make us feel guilty for not leaving a tip.  First time in my life that I didn't leave a tip.  The service was that bad.  Staff was disrespectful, unaccountable and just plain rude.  DON'T GO HERE!  Had a great time at Calico Jack's across the way.  If you're in Glendale go anywhere but McFadden's!  The place is a joke!
Walked in today for lunch. I literally stood there for 10 mins waiting to be seated and I saw a few employees see me and no one came to seat us.

Went there with a group of friends.  All in our mid 40s.  The Bouncers were rude, the Bartenders didn't care to serve us.  Terrible experience, definitely won't be going there EVER again.  There were a few security guards that thought they were "something".  With this economy, it's a shame that rude employees are still working.  Management needs an overhaul at this place.
How are you an Irish Bar and out of Corned Beef?  Wow, that is not a very good first impression.

We tried this place because we got 'free' drink coupons at a spring training game. They were only good for light beer even thought they said any domestic beer.   The burgers were flat and dry and the tater tots tasted like they were from a frozen bag.   Sorry. Would not recommend this spot. Lots of other good restaurants in the plaza.

We went here on Jan 1st before the Fiesta Bowl, not to busy when we arrived at 8am.. Ordered from a special menu ( extra high prices ) for breakfast the food wasn't that bad, compared to the C rats we had in 1969. We asked for butter for our toast and water by the time we were almost done we asked another employee and he finally brought us some. When the bill came I didn't notice the 20% tip was included, I tipped $8.00 on a 35.00 charge plus the 20%.we would have done better having breakfast inside the stadium.  Interesting comment from above, our credit card was also compromise 9 days latter for $230.00 at two locations in the area, not pointing any finger, just saying. I suggest the manager spend some time at Ri Ra's in Las Vegas, now that's a real Irish bar with great food and great service.

1 star for drinks. 2 stars for everything else.   My husband and I went here because we had a restaurant.com $25 gift certificate. I've been to Westgate numerous times, but never McFaddens. We went during happy hour, & knew we couldn't use it on anything happy hour, but it was ok, because none of our drinks or food were on happy hour anyway. We'd be getting $25 off of our bill of $50, so half off. The place was dead. There were 2 other tables with people.   The mixed drinks, horrible. My husband ordered a Long Island Iced Tea. A Long Island has 4 different kinds of alcohol in it & a splash coke. His drink looked like pink lemonade.  He cringed when he drank it. Me, I hate the taste of liquor. I tried his drink knowing it's supposed to have 4 kinds of alcohol in it. It tasted exactly like peach juice. There was no alcohol in the drink. I would say zero alcohol. No coke either. It was peachy tasting water. We waited and waited on the waitress to come back to send the drink back. She didn't come back. He went up to the bar and told the bartender to remake the drink while he was standing there watching him. The bartender made a new drink. It was an actual Long Island, and looked completely different side by side to the original drink. It tasted like it should have. My husband told the bartender that the next drink he orders, he wants him to make it. My husband orders drink #2, from the same bartender who he already complained to. The drink was just as bad & awful as the 1st one he sent back. He took the drink back to the bartender, again, and told the bartender it was peach juice. The bartender complained, and copped an attitude, saying they don't over pour their alcohol. We weren't asking them to over pour. We were asking them to make a Long Island, that contains alcohol, and not serve watered down peach juice.   The tvs were good. The food was average tasting. The menu food was about $8-$14. They have happy hour pricing on some appetizers, and some drinks.    We were so angry about the drinks and attitudes, we had to leave. The $25 off didn't matter. I'm giving them 2 stars because we did get half off the food, my beers, and peach water.   If you're going for mixed drinks, don't go here. It's the worse mixed drinks we've had. When you complain, they turn it around on you, like it's your fault.

They were wonderful! So friendly! Served quickly and efficiently! Great experience! They were busy, but made us feel very attended to. Everyone from the hostesses, waitress, and busboys were polite and accommodating!

If this establishment were located anywhere else it would die the death it so much deserves.  We waited for over an hour to be seated only to be served the worse bar food we have ever encountered, it's hard to screw up chicken wings but mcfaddens did a fine job in doing so. Not only was the food bad but we were offered plastic dinner ware because they ran out of the metal forks and knives. There are to many other choices in the area to try,stay away from this place at all cost you'll be glad you did.

Terrible and unprofessional service. I work in the industry so I tend to be more lenient than others because I understand the inter-workings of a bar. However, I still expect to be treated with respect and professionalism. Upon entering I was just stared at by 3 workers but was not greeted at all. The "manager" if you could call her that was bad mouthing some of her guests to other bar guests. I found this appalling! If I were the owner I would be reading these awful reviews and making some changes. I will not be returning.

If you are looking for a place that steals your credit card information look no further. If you have dined here in the past check out your credit card statements. You will see fraudulent charges on your account following dining at this dump. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!
Great place for bike night! 1/2 off beers and apps!  Our go to place when we come here! Totally recommend!

Horrible. I will never eat at any McFadden's again. We waited for almost 15 minutes before we were even able to order waters. The Fish and Chips I received were so disgusting I actually lost my appetite. They were covered in so much batter most of it wasn't cooked and they were so soggy. I had to peel off the batter layer just to eat the fish. The Caesar Salad was miserable, hardly worth paying $5 for it but ended up costing $14. The menu stated the Caesar Salad without chicken is $11 but we were charged $14 because the menu and our waitress neglected to tell us that their menu prices are wrong. Aside from the fact that their food is gross, the place was so warm, smelt horrible and had flies all over the place. Don't eat here, it's an overpriced dump.

Came on January 9th.   Paid $35 cover for my group of family / friends. Seated at a table. After 15 minutes we asked the bar to have a server come by. Waited another 10 minutes, still nothing.   25 minutes with no recognition of us being there.   We spoke with the front attendant about being there 25 minutes already without a hello. One laughed, said keep waiting. At that point, I asked for our cover back. He laughed again.   Won't be back, our group ended up spending $1250 at a nearby establishment that night.   I now see the great Yelp reviews they have reflect our similar experience.

I would not recommend or ever go back.  Seemed dirty and unorganized. We went for lunch, at 2pm, and everything seemed disheveled from the night before.   Our waitress was unattentive and lingered coming back to the table. They were out of the fish and chips, so I ordered a burger. My husband ordered the Shepherds pie, and we had the jalapeño poppers. The poppers were ok, my burger was cooked correctly but lacked flavor.  My husband ate his shepherd's pie out of hunger. This is not a good restaurant and bar.  No wonder it was almost completely empty when the other restaurants/bars who busy. Never again!

I walked into here lastnight with my sister sat down , got up after 5 minutes and asked for a waitress, one finally came got our water and order of chicken fingers after the fingers I wanted the check so  I  tried asked for the check but the waiter just fast paced walked by(let me mention it was slow not busy) so I asked another girl and she went to the back so I asked another waitress, she went and sat down but repeatedly looked back at our table?? So I asked another waitress which she finally grabbed my check & brought it back. I left a comment on the receipt, I was pretty upset, did not want to order anything else from the poor service from the brunette waitresses. After walking out I stood on the other side of the street waiting for some friends and looked towards McFaddens and noticed her doing motions towards me like if she was calling me out to fight which in my case is not what a waitress should do on the job , so completely poor service and poor behavior. Nice scene but poor poor wait staff and service.

DO NOT GO HERE. We had a party of 25 before a football game at University of Phoenix stadium and 4 of our cards have fraud alerts and we're used in various states around the country within 5 days. Manager said they "We're aware of the problem because of a dated credit card system."  Stay away and BEWARE!!!!!

Just had to share our terrible experience with this restaurant, looking at their listing for yelp, obviously we are not alone so I will keep it brief.   Food, pedestrian at best, although as expected for a glorified sports bar.  Wings were as dry as the desert we live in, worst we ever had, but after interacting with "management", and trust me I use that word loosely, it was probably by design to increase beer sales. My wife ordered a glass of wine, received something that was not close to what she wanted and the only response from our friendly but utterly incompetent food server was "what do you want me to do about it?", and "maybe you can reconsider on your second round", like we were actually going to keep throwing good money after bad and actually risk ordering anything else from this place.  Again, kind of expected from a place like this so we laughed about the odd response from the waitress and asked for the check.  We have always purchased an Entertainment Book, it gets us to try new places and you save a buck or two which is always a nice plus.  We gave it to her on the mobile app, she took the phone to the "manager" (again loosely used) and came back saying we cannot use it because the wings were considered an appetizer not a main course and you have to have two main courses to get the one free per their offer.  The wings were about the same price as my chicken sandwich any other real restaurant would have gladly taken off the least expensive item and moved on with everyone happy.  Not this place, even though it would have cost them the same or less than any other main course they refused to honor it.  OK, we laughed again and paid.  Then my wife noticed that they executed the coupon offer on the phone, you can only use it once so not only did they not accept it, it is now invalid for any future use.  Obviously we will never go back here again, even if it were totally free, but the point is they had no right to take the coupon and then not honor their offer.  We explained to the waitress about all of this and that we were upset about the entire experience and she just basically smiled and told us to have a good night.  At the hostess stand on the way out I asked to see the "manager" to let him know of our experience and the issue with the Entertainment card, he just stared at me blankly as I went through all the issues and, like the waitress, said nothing except OK.  His name is Baron, in defense of the restaurant I am not really sure he is a manager, looks and acts more like a bouncer and he seemed more interested in impressing the young hostesses as to how rudely he could treat me then actually acting like a manger and trying to resolve any of the issues I raised.  He gave me the General Managers card and told me to call him and deal with it, just what any GM wants in his manager.   Obviously I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone, I think we would have been better off going to Jack in the Box, the food would have been about the same quality, if not better and less expensive, the service would have been much better, and at least the Clown would have smiled.....

Quite possibly one of the worst meals I've ever eaten. My wife ordered fish & chips, I had a burger. Both thought we'd be up with food poisoning. Generally you have an idea how good or bad a restaurant is by amount of people there. Well it was a Friday night at 6pm and there were less than a dozen people dining. If we didn't have Restaurants.com 25 off a 50, we would NEVER eat here. This has to be the red headed step child of Westgate!! Keep walking and find a dozen other places to eat.
Mediocre says it all.... food, service, atmosphere....1 star for being near the stage

This place has an amazing happy hour and with the economy in a state of CRISIS I would much rather pay $2 bucks for a cocktail than $7. We have been in multiple times and we have a blast every time. We generally sit on the outside patio bar where Jay works on Saturdays. He is a hoot and has had us coming back for months now (We just moved here). It's always great to see a bartender with a sense of urgency. We still get the club feel outside with as busy as it gets, it's just not quite as loud on the patio. We had the fried fish this last weekend and would say its one of the best meals we have had in some time. Thanks Mcfadden's for being our favorite place to hang.

This place has the rudest most unprofessional bartenders I have ever dealt with, no wonder they get tipped pennies...and the DJ that tries to DJ is horrible, definitely needs to shut up and play music instead of talking nonsense for most of the night. Worst place ever and why would anyone even think throwing napkins just for fun is kool? Ridiculous Lol..McFadden at Westgate will never be recommended by me.

How disappointing is this place. Don't ask the waitress if you can substitute their burgers or wraps with chicken without getting a blank stare (even though it says on the menu substitute with chicken). Then she came back and told me the chef can do a chicken wrap like she did me a favor. Give her a pat on the back please!  Molly's tater tots on the apps menu was simply a pile of frozen tots, blob of sour cream, sprinkled with cheese, and there ya go. Overpriced, grumpy waitresses, not coming back.
Terrible customer service. Quick to kick people out for no reason. Never coming here again.  Not law enforcement or military friendly. Terrible management.
This bar is extremely lame. All the bartenders except maybe one have horrible attitudes and make your drinks extremely weak. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

EPIC FAIL.   The food - good.  The servers - awful.  the bartenders and management - should be fired.  My reason?  The manager feels it's ok to bring his infant to the bar - I'll give him that it was 6:00pm on a Sunday - HOWEVER I will not give him that he was BEHIND the bar, serving drinks.  His kid was asleep. In a car carrier.  On a table.  about 30' away from him.   When I chose to complain about the level of inappropriate this was - what happened? Oh, we were asked to leave.  3 minutes after our food arrived.  For a party of 8.   I will never step foot in this place again.  At first I didn't blame the guy.  Good for you for not being a piece of s&%* and trying to handle business by doing your job an dsupporting your kid.  But when someone tells you it's inappropriate you have the nerve to kick them out because you dont like it?   I'll never go back to McFadden's or any where else they own.  Clearly they have crappy management, feel it's okay to dosrespect their patrons and that children of any age belong in a bar.  Supervised or not.

We paid over 500$ for a table asked the manager to come out he came and talked to us promised a meet and great with pauly d (that we had paid for) at the end they kicked us out and said we didn't pay for it after the manager chris had promised us we did, I asked for him again and instead we had security escort us out and told us when he was done for the night he would come out and talk to us. They were super rude and We were treated very poor for customers who had spent over 500$ in the facility! I will be contacting higher management.

This place is far worse than just a crappy sports bar with mediocre food.  It's a breeding ground for power-hungry, roided-up bouncers to physically abuse guests under management that has no problem looking the other way.  We watched the Super Bowl there, and look, I get it - it's clearly a challenge for any bar to manage that amount of activity and people.  That said, when they claimed to see my wife cutting in line to use the bathroom (she in fact saw a friend and was going to say hi) -they grabbed her and literally physically slung her out the front door.  She was shocked and ready to go talk to the police about it, but a manager stopped her from doing so and invited her back in. We wish we had left at this juncture.  Instead, after the game finished, the same bouncer approached my wife.  I intervened at this point - asking if there was a problem.  It was at this point that I was placed into a violent choke-hold and forced to the floor.  Other members of my party started video-taping because it was so egregious - other bouncers then screamed at them to turn off the cameras.  And keep in mind, no one in our party was drunk or unruly.  These bouncers simply decided that they wanted to get us out of the bar using a crazy amount of force.  They did the same thing to another member of our party-  who just happened to be the 70-year-old mother of our friend.  They called her a b**** repeatedly and bent her arm behind her back.  We tried to go to police at this point, but the logistics of doing so with thousands of fans emptying out of the stadium at the same time, proved too difficult.  it is our hope to provide local AZ television stations with our videotaped footage to spur potential legal action or at the very least prevent other customers from being physically abused there in the future.  In the meantime - stay far away from this place.  It's awful.

I've been there a couple of times and did not like it at all. I think what pushed me over the edge was this past weekend.  I was out celebrating my birthday and the DJ y'all had was horrible! He didn't let the song play for more than 15 seconds! I couldn't even enjoy dancing. Also the DJ was telling the ladies to get on top of the bar for a free shot, ghetto I might add, which caused another lady to get upset that she had an ass in her face, pushed her. I understand people act stupid, but the security didn't handle it well at all. I got my foot stepped by them and pushed out of the way. That was my last straw, I will never go back.
This place is hit or miss for sure, not a big fan though. I like to get my dance on and this place isn't that great for it. Drinks are the same as everywhere else but good luck getting one.

A friend of mine had happy hour there so there was no need to pay for cover which was a plus. However just to get a drink it took forever and the order wasnt even correct. Bartender will walk past you and skip your turn at lest five times before you even get a drink. Pretty good sized crowd but service not so great. We even had a table and you get your drink at the table just as fast as standing at the bar.  Haven't had a great Reuben sandwich in awhile and heard from a friend that the corned beef here was amazing so decided to give it a try in the day time.  The sandwich arrived and it looked really delicious and tasted like heaven. I'm big on sauerkraut and McFaddens wasn't stingy at all.  The corned beef wasnt too fatty just how i like it. I got extra dressing on the side to dip my sandwich in. It came with a side of red potato salad that was also mouth watering.   Will return to eat!

DO NOT use your credit card here.  We were a party of 4, the bill was to be split between 3 credit cards.  Short story, each card was charged SIX times for various amounts.  When the server kept swiping our cards they got declined after the third swipe because the bank recognized it as fraud.  The server then came to our table and loudly announced that our cards were declined.  She failed to mention that she swiped each card SIX times!  She also included a 20% automatic gratuity that totaled $45 which we were never made aware of.  Since when is there an automatic grat for a party of 4? We are now waiting for the restaurant manager to respond.  Stay tuned...  Side note, the service was deplorable.  The food came and we had no silverware.  We had to request place settings and the server returned with a stack of cocktail napkins and no silverware!  The server also couldn't offer us any cocktails because she only knew the beer menu and couldn't give us a list of any other alcohol available. We had to ask repeatedly for water, napkins and all the basics.    They definitely have a good scam going- charge the customers and hope they don't notice or compare bills.  Luckily our banks were smarter than the server, which doesn't require much at all considering she didn't know the difference between a place setting and a cocktail napkin.  Update-.Just this week I was notified by my bank that the same credit card number used at McFadden's was used fraudulently for over $1,000 at another business in Glendale. Since I don't live in Glendale and haven't been there since the incident at McFadden's it seems more than a coincidence.  Some of my family who were charged multiple times haven't had the charges reversed and the manager has been full of promises but no results.

It's only a matter of time before the owner, Joe "Picicucca" as found in business registration records for this restaurant, is arrested. The credit card scam being run here is very similar to a credit card scam that was run half a decade ago at Calico Jack's, oddly also located at Westgate, when a manager named Joe "Picciuca" was working there. Whatever the man's real surname is, the service here is deplorable even without having to deal with removing illicit charges from your credit cards. The food is actually sometimes passable, although not worth the pricetag.

My family and I stopped here on a whim to hang out in Westgate. Wow....it was the dirtiest restaurant Ive ever eaten in. The menu covers were disgustingly dirty and the large leather yellow dining room chair arms were horribly filthy and ripped and torn leather. I do not have small children but I could see the wooden high chairs from where I was sitting, I definatly would not put a child in one,  they were even dirtier than the chairs and menus. The food was so-so. Only nice/good thing I can report was our waitress was nice and courteous.

Went here for dinner. Place was empty. Table was sticky. Soda was not carbonated. Food took over 30 minutes to be served and everything ordered was only sandwiches and a burger. The waitress was nice but nothing else about the food was worth a second visit.

We've been to this establishment more than a few times always giving them the benefit of doubt that next time our service may be better but nope, not the case. The last visit topped it off for us to not give them anymore of our $. Not knowing that barstools are removed from the bar just before a game is over, my brother met up with another brother there  (Westgate), he is a disabled Navy vet, can't stand too long and asked the bartender if he could pull up a barstool to sit and was given the ok. Minutes later the manager comes up to him saying he couldn't use that stool and said he needed it asap, my brother told him he was disabled and the mgr replied "I don't care!" Wth? I was appalled at the treatment my brother received, disgraceful. On anther note, the service has always been bad, one visit we waited an hour for our food only to be told by the waitress she had forgotten to place our order. The bathrooms are always yucky and from what other people have said, their floors are always sticky. So never again will we be going to this place.
This place charged my friends and I 4X the amount expected.  After countless calls and visiting the location we still ended up with 2X the charges for the service provided.
Will never come back, they blast offensive sexual content songs at 8pm with young children in the area, when asked if it could be turned down was told no we are a bar

This place is completely lame! Why you may ask? Horrible wait staff with bad attitudes, expensive bland unoriginal food. The lamest point of all is the other night before a Coyotes game we stopped in to eat and watch the TNF game. At least half of the TV's were glitching and horrible quality. Stay away, stay far away. Plenty of other places to hang in Westgate. Oh yeah this is probably only on a game night but beers are served in plastic cups only 3/4 full. Did I say lame

I used to frequent McFaddens pretty frequently, particularly as a go-to place for a good meal at a reasonable price before a hockey game.  I went there last evening though and this was definitely my final trip there.  Just awful experience.  My party was seated within 5 minutes - so far so good.  Our server was pleasant and tried to be attentive.  However, she was spread across at least twice as many tables as a single server can reasonably cover, so her ability to check in with us was hampered.  I don't fault her for any of the adverse experience though.  The management there should be completely scrapped.  it took an hour for our food to arrive and each person in my party had a very simple meal that should have taken at most 10 minutes to make.  The server confirmed that they had only 1 cook working and he was covering the entire restaurant.  The establishment was filled at every table, so obviously this was horrible planning on the management's part.  When the food finally arrived, it was not what I had come to expect.  I and one of my party ordered our old favorite - the fish and chips.  The price had come up about $3/plate on this meal, but hey, whatever.  However, when it was delivered we had half of the fish pieces over before and less than 1/4 of the fries.  The coleslaw was horrible, too - and that used to be my favorite part.  The portions used to be too big but this was an insane swing in the opposite direction to couple with a significant price hike.  $16.99 for a kid-sized meal from McDonalds.  The fish was also undercooked.  The 3rd member of my party ordered a chicken club.  It came out with this 1/4 inch thick triangle of chicken jerky that he literally had to take the bun off in order to find.  The bun was 2 inches thick in total.  Suffice it to say he got bread with a hint of chicken flavoring.  Because of how horribly inefficient the service was, at this point we have 15 minutes until our hockey game started.  We alerted the server to our concerns when going to pay the bill.  She immediately engaged the manager, but after 10 minutes we had to flag her down to find out what was going on - we still hadn't received a receipt to sign.  She server informed us that the manager decided not to charge us but should have been by.  He never appeared.  Upon departing we found him hanging out on the back patio bar area, chatting and laughing with people that were obviously his friends.  I haven't had such a poor experience at any restaurant in recent memory.  Stay away from this place - it used to be pretty decent but has completely fallen apart.  While waiting for our food we observed much the same with other patrons - very unhappy faces and a few groups that just walked out in disgust without having gotten food served.

Our bartenders and servers were fantastic! Our drinks and food were good. The smell in the restaurant and bar area was awful. The bathroom was worse. Shame on the city and Gila River for not resolving the sewer issues

This could possibly be the WORST venue I have ever been to.   I had an event here with around 50 people 2 groups of 24 plus myself & my assistant.  It's was probably 110 degree outside in the Desert Summer.   They had ALL the doors open. It was well over 90 degrees inside the location.   1 of my guest actually said it was cooler outside.  The paramedics actually had to come cause someone fainted in the bathroom.  The staff was completely RUDE!  Every last one of them!  The security told 3 of my female attendees that everyone was leaving as he was checking their IDs to get in.  Half of the staff were posted up on the back wall, with one foot on leaned up on the wall let they had to hold it up.  The server hardly ever came over to take drink orders let alone clean up!  I was bussing my own tables.   The one time I went to ask the server to come over she was in the back service well.  And not 1 single employee moved from thier wall post so I could get by to ask her to come take care of the group.  When I asked someone to turn the lights up so my group could see papers they were filling out for the event, he made a HUGE deal about it.  Then when I went the second time to ask about the lights again, I stood at the bar and over heard 2 of your employees bad mouthing my request! If you didn't want the group there you shouldn't have booked our event.   Never again will I set foot in this horrible bar even for a drink, let alone bring it a 50 person event.

Extremely rude staff. The service or lack there of was ridiculous. They just built a new location at Desert Ridge that I will NEVER visit because of this experience. Good luck making it there with service like this!
30 mins sitting at a table, waitress never showed. Walked out with nothing. Why does this place exist?

The waitress did not ask if we wanted water or a to go box. When she checked up on us once she didn't stop walking. She just said your still doing fine right and kept walking. When we gave her the cards for the bill she dropped one on the ground and some random person picked it up. The food was not made correctly.

So I went here for lunch the other day expecting good fish and chips...well I was wrong!  They were fish sticks! Who the hell serves those anymore?  I sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and nice. The highpoint of my lunch for sure.  So MAYBE I had a Guinness for lunch. What I didnt expect was $7 for the pint! Am I seriously back home in NY right now??   FIsh and chips and MAYBE a beer + tip = $32 for lunch!!  Total rip off--never again.

Fun place! Bad smell though.... I love how we can get on the bar and dance for shots lol. My last visit here I was kicked out though. Someone had dropped their *glass* drink on the floor next to me and some of the glass cut my foot. I was bleeding and instead of helping me... they wanted me to leave. I won't be going back.
The food is not the best. Service is ok but they forgot to give silverware. We had 4 different servers not sure why? Very unorganized.

We (5 of us) went into mcfaddens  on 3/19/14 at approximately 7:13, we were sat and 10 mins went by and nobody saw us. I check the time because I'm a server myself and know about seeing people within 90 secs and we were pressed for time because we were going to a concert. So I went up to bar, after another 3 mins the bartender asked what I need and I said no one has seen us and it's been a while. The bartender came out and offered us drinks, I said we needed to order and she said go ahead. We gave 5 orders of drinks and food and she wrote nothing down. As soon as she walked away I said she would get order wrong, I knew she would because she didn't write it down. At least she made an attempt to help us because a server never did. She brought out our 1st round and some water. Then 20 mins went by and we asked about our food. The restaurant was dead, it shouldn't take that long. We stopped some random host/server and said that we have to leave and to just cancel the order. She went to tell manager after a couple mins a girl came over and said the food is ready, I said we'll take it in boxes because we have to go. Sure enough only 4 orders came out and my order was wrong. The manager said he was comping drinks for the wait and the meal that did not go out so he was going to run the payment for remainder of food. I went to go find him and tell him that my order was wrong as well, he came over and verified it was. He said we could have it anyway, and that the other order that was missing was ready. He brought it out and said he was sorry, I told him that I knew it wasn't his fault but our experience should not have happened this way. So after we left I opened up the box to the order that was missing and the bread was burnt to all 3 sliders. My friend didn't eat that, I ate part of the cold burger that I didn't order and girlfriend ate some of her wings - in the car - because we spent 50+ mins at Mcfaddens for terrible service, incorrect and burnt food that we didn't even get to eat in restaurant. Very disappointed.

Been to this bar 3 times now and every time I have had to correct the wait staff when it came time to pay the check. They have added drinks and food that we didn't order all three times. Was there this past weekend and they added a drink we didn't order. Out side of that its a fun place in a great location. 1 star for bad service. Keep track of what you order.

Is less than one star available? No stars. You disgusting food microwaving bad service loud ass stupid people should go on bar rescue  or something. Rubbery fish and chips? 20 dollar microwaved teenie steak with 3 shrimp?  Who microwaves food at a restaurant! A horrid waste of 50 dollars on my birthday. Thanks guys. Oh also tell your DJs. Making the mic louder than the music and loud enough people were leaving. MIIIGHT be a bad idea. Get a new owner.

We went to McFadden's for St. Patrick's Day last year and again a week ago.  Last year was AMAZING FUN!  I would give the place 5 stars.  This year was LAME!  There was a cover charge for a restaurant/bar that was self seating.  There were no tables/seats available at 5 PM.  They were serving hamburgers from the hostess station...?  We were able to finally find a waitress for our standing only bar table.  The food was great, but I may have been intoxicated by that time.  After we finished our food they removed our table to make room for a dance floor.  The whole experience was nothing compared to last year's celebration that included bag pipes, bands, and great service.  Not sure what happened to McFadden's AZ.

We drove  3 hours to see a hockey game and met up with a friend that was visiting the Phoenix area. We chose McFadden s because it wasn't crowded so we could visit. It was just 4 of us and very few other patrons. I.had to look for a chair that wasn't broken and after 4 attempts I found I felt safe to sit on. We only ordered beers and when we asked for a 2nd round we waited 20 minutes and still our beers weren't delivered. I searched for our waitress and she was just standing at the end of the bar on her cell phone and when I asked her if she was bringing our beers she just so said "oh sorry I forgot".  At 6.00 dollars a beer this was disappointing!  Broken chairs, ash trays and tables outside were dirty. This place is a disaster and will never go back. Oh, and the smell of sewage from the bathrooms was horrible!
This place sucks. Food is horrible and the drinks are way overpriced.

Terrible!  First visit was a train wreck. ..literally out of 3/4 of their menu...was overcharged for what we did order, spoke with the manager who seemed sincerely apologetic and explained they had several people walk out and not show up that day along with a few other problems. Decided to give them another try since we had a $50 gift certificate for them... never, ever again!!! The place smelled like it was having sewage issues, it was completely empty of customers except us. We were given menus, spent 10 min deciding what we wanted and then the hostess came back and said she had mistakenly given us the regular menu and that they were on "event" menus this week because of all the extra games going on.  She explained that the event menu was just a condensed version of their regular menu... um NO, that was not the only difference. ..the event menu is more expensive and does not include happy hour (which we were there for). Apparently the manager was the one to direct the hostess to replace our menus. Clueless! We walked out, spent $60 at another restaurant despite having the gift card for this joke of a place and won't be back!

12/13/2015 - Really poor food choices - for an Irish restaurant, the menu only has 2 'possible' Irish dishes, though the staff had no idea what the ingredients were nor how they were prepared. They served Guinness in a Smithwick's 12 ounce glass (not even a pint glass), the floor was filthy, littered with food droppings, napkins and other garbage, the servers and manager were rude (they correct us for ordering the wrong tator tots) and the place smelled like grease. Will never go there again and will warn all my family and friends to stay away. If a place could get negative stars, this place would qualify. Really bad restaurant experience.

My wife bought a half off deal coupon before I got a chance to review this place on Yelp. (Something I always do.) But I thought I'd look anyways before we went and it looked pretty dismal. I didn't even want to go. I had assumed from walking by in the past it was a reputable establishment but the poor reviews were so numerous.  Boy, was I surprised! Now granted it was a Sunday late afternoon and it was dead. so we were seated promptly. Classic rock played medium-softly in the background. Lots of TVs with sports shows surrounded us.   Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Our drinks arrived in a couple minutes. (They had happy hour pricing. Buds $2, well drinks $3, some appetizers $4.) Some drinks are limited as they don't have a blender. So you won't get a frozen margarita but one on the rocks. Our food arrived in several minutes. Everything was hot. In fact we had to wait for it to cool off!  My Reuban sandwich ($10.99) was big and piled high with tender corned beef on thick marbled rye. Seasoned steak fries were hot and crispy. My wife's BBQ wings ($9.99) were big and meaty and the honey BBQ sauce made them look like jewels. All was good. I'd go back.  Maybe all the bad reviews made them change their ways. I did take away one star due to high prices. They could stand to take a couple bucks off.

Went there after a concert.  We were asked if we want outdoor or indoor.  It wasn't too cold out so we said out.  We were not asked if we wanted smoking or non-smoking and never having been there before I didn't know there were two sides.  They sat us in smoking so we had to go back inside and ask for another table.  Attitudes were not very nice.  It took forever to place an order and when it finally arrived, it was cold.  We tried to get someone's attention a couple of times, but finally gave up.  This is one restaurant we won't be returning to.  There are plenty more in that area to choose from.

I visited from California and wanted to check out a fun bar to dance at with my 4 friends. The two boys paid a 10$ cover and we all got drinks immediately. No more then 3 minutes after receiving the drinks, two of them get knocked over from a girl walking by. We immediately go up to the same bartender (as a worker is cleaning up the mess behind us), explain that the brand new drinks got knocked over and he proceeds to say, "well what if everyone in the bar came up to me saying their drinks got spilled want wanted a new free one??" So we order another drink expecting not to be charged for it. A couple minutes later we were still upset and decided to leave. Receive our bills and were charged for the spilled and new drinks. On the way out, we are trying to finish the drinks fast and a girl bumps into my drink and it gets spilled AGAIN. We find a manager and explain the story and his response was "sorry a lot of our bartenders act like assholes." As if that made it okay? So he gets us one free drink and then we explain what happened earlier about the first two drinks had spilled and he goes "wait outside and I will get you guys covered." We waited outside and we see him chatting away with the hostess at the front for about 10 minutes hanging out. Basically he had no desire to help us, he shooed us away outside so he didn't have to deal with us.   I've been in the service industry for 9 years and this was the absolute worst customer service I've experienced in a long time. I'm understanding of drunk rude people trying to get free things but this was our first bar and were completely polite. Even worse that we were visiting and this was our first impression of the city. If I could I would give it zero stars.
IF you are a wanna be gansta, like rude service and poor quality, over priced food......MAN, You are in for a treat. EVEN the security guards have bad attitudes!

I gave this place a 2nd try - still terrible.  We went to the Westgate area to eat at one particular place, but it was closed.  I had my ent coupon book with me and this place is in it so I thought might as well try it one more time since it is a BOGO.  The 1st time we went the food was OK but the service was terrible.  I thought the place was a bit run down but to be expected in the area w/ folks only frequenting it as a place to get loaded on game days.  It was a bit busy that night and they were clearly short staffed so I thought to give them a break.  So when our 1st choice was closed tonight - I thought we would give it another try.  Still terrible facilities...this time there was so much dirt on the ledge beside our table I could write my name in it.  There was only one server working as waitress and hostess - OK I guess since we were only one of 3 tables the whole time we were there.  The tea was clearly old (or from an unclean musty dispenser) and I had her take it back & give me a soda instead.  When she went to bring my soda back, she delivered my coke to another table and returned their credit card to us...I would have been HOT if I was the other guests - it was really shocking - very careless service!  We placed our order including the appetizer and waited.  Waited  Waited  finally our food comes - and we just said take the appetizer off the bill.  She was surprised that it never came out....Really? your are the only server in the place - do you think it grew wings and brought itself to our table?  Ordered traditional Pub faire - Bangers & Mash.  Hubby had Corned beef.  It was OK - the Corned beef was tough - I can make it better at home.  All in all - once again - disappointing.  Above all I can't believe how dirty this establishment is.  Obviously you are slow on non-game days....you have plenty of time to clean and GET ORDER RIGHT!  Will Not be returning ever!  even with a coupon!

So disappointing, it states that McFaddens is a 49ers bar but then they play the Colts volume in game on the big screen and refuses to turn the volume on for the 49ers. And I've had nothing but issues with food 3 weeks in a row Joe the manager did make the food right took a couple of tries. Just so disappointed will not be back if your 49ers  Niner fan don't come here.

This is an over priced sudo pub that used to be a sports bar and should be closed. The service always sucks - day or night . I've been dragged there several occasions   by friends who "wanted to check it out" each time was worse than the time before. I guess having staff that is almost nude is better than having staff that actually will bring you your order.  Some one told me it was supposed to be an Irish Pub... it's not even close.

Being from Chicago,  I was quite happy to see a familiar name. Good sized place, and the music was great all night. It got a little crowded, and I bumped into the guy next to me and spilled some of his drink. I apologized, bought him a new one and shook his hand. 5 minutes later 3 security guards walk up behind me and tell me I have to leave. No one can tell me what I did, but I wasn't going to get belligerent or argue with them, but being totally classless they kept shoving me as the bartender who was closing my tab was running my card. Even he asked what happened, and was just as dumbfounded as I was. So, if you come here, be careful.

One word......WOW!!!!  My family and I dined at McFadden's yesterday afternoon and I have a few things I would like to bring to everyone's attention. First of all I ordered the chili cheese nachos and the actual tortilla chips were horrible. I'm not sure if they are freshly made but if they were they were probably fried in rancid oil possibly. Secondly, while my wife was in the restroom, one of the waitresses came into the restroom while holding a customers dinner.  She went fully in and once she saw my wife she exited as fast as she could. I truly cannot believe that happened.   Stay far away!!!!! Trust me!!!
This place charged me for stuff I didn't even buy. Never again. Watch your wallets around here people

Maybe a Sunday night of a Cardinals home game is not the best night to experience McFadden's but if they can't handle the football crowd then maybe they shouldn't have opened their doors at Westgate.   The female bartenders were RUDE. They passed my friend up several times before letting him order his drink. And, they got snarky with people sitting next to us. They seem to be cut from similar cloth and it ain't pretty.   The 30-45 minute wait for a table turned out to be more than an hour. No surprise, but they didn't bother to tell us we could have gotten a table on the patio off of the bar right away.   Ordered the turkey club sandwich which was supposed to be served with bacon and cranberry mayo on Texas toast. Guess I looked like I need to trim the fat from my diet because my sandwich was baconless. And, they ran out of sliders, buffalo wings and boneless wings BEFORE 7 p.m. What kind of bar runs out of bar food before the peak dinner crowd has even arrived???? The fries were pretty good and our table service was very friendly at least.   There are lots of TVs all tuned to the game and the Cardinals and Vikings fans all seemed to be getting along well. No pushing, shoving or name calling. So, the first impression was not great but I'm willing to give it another chance ... maybe.
This place should be shut down- they are essentially thieves. Had a horrible time here.. Overpriced, poor service, meathead staff

Horrible. Sports bar/club? It's a good thing the investors own other establishments that make them able to keep this crappy place open. Either the ownership doesn't care or they are that dumb. The overall cleanliness is 2. The service was 3. At any moment there were 4+ associates standing around chatting it up. I understand over staffing for busy hours and having downtime, but when the business is failing so bad at cleanliness it's not acceptable. There seemed to be no supervision nor did any associate seem concerned about the well being of the patron. Good luck with your future business decisions as I do hope they improve and there is some accountability with the management.

The Shepherd's Pie listed on the Irish Faire section of the menu was mediocre, at best. It was soupy and greasy. It was basically ground beef soup. The vegetables were almost nonexistent. There were only a couple of bits of carrot. Peas, a customary ingredient, were missing. For $14.99, I expected a large serving and expected to take some home. The serving was less than generous. For a place that claims to be Irish, they need someone to show them how to prepare Shepherd's Pie. The Sam Adams Octoberfest was good.

Don't use your credit card here.  They have a credit card stealing problem from what it seems.  I was there for a Coyote game in December and stopped in for a drink.  A week later my card was compromised.  Too many Yelpers here saying the same thing to be coincidence.
This place is so poorly managed and aweful, it's difficult to make an emphasis. They just don't care about their service. At all... So odd...

Do not eat here. I would give negative stars if I could. Waitress charged me $10 more.  When disputing it, she said that's because of tax, when it clearly said subtotal. It was my birthday and I waited an hour and a half for my bill, missed my movie. The manager is even worse. He slammed the receipt and rolled his eyes. I couldn't believe it. I wasnt rude, I was just disputing the charge. Theres a whole list more to say negative about this place, but it would be 2 pages long. ALSO, check your bill, they will try to charge you extra than what the menu states.

My fiancée and I got engaged yesterday. My new soon to be mother in law happened to be at this establishment and my parents and I happened to be across the way at yard house. We walked over to talk to her for a minute since both the families parents happened to be there. My fiancées mother was a paying customer at the bar, there was one barstool available at the bar next to her so my fiancée sat there and the rest of the family stood and talked to her for about 20 minutes before the bartender told us if the rest of us aren't going to drink we need to leave. There were other spots available to sit in the restaurant. We weren't bothering anybody and we're happy to stand while only taking up ONE barstool. I've never been told to move at a bar before for no reason and I thought that was pretty rude. Don't go here. Go to the yard house. You will have a better experience.

If I could give this place less than a star, I would. I'm not allowed back in here after being kicked out for taking a picture of my friend. Yes, that's exactly why. I was here on a Friday night with my friend, drinking, hanging out. And she asked me to take a picture of her with her drink in hand. So I said of course. I took out my phone and right as I did a security guard came up to me and said no camera. I had never heard of this any of the million times I had been there before. So I simply asked why and he grabbed me by the arm and threatened to kick me out if I didn't calm down. I wasn't being aggressive at all and even the crowd around me was telling the security guards that I didn't do anything to be kicked out. But it didn't matter. They just escorted me out and that was that. I've had multiple incidents here but that one was just too much. So I decided I wouldn't go back anymore. I even had my drink spilled on the floor after a different security guard bumped into me on purpose. There was nobody around me for miles but he chose to walk right into me. I had told the manager about it but he didn't even want to hear me. Do yourself a favor and never come here. Unless terrible service is your thing.

I will NEVER go back to this place again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They aren't even worth the one star that I had to rate them with! My fiance and I went there on a Thursday night to meet a good friend that was in from out of town for just one night. After we waited in line for about 10 minutes, the door guy told my fiance that he wasn't allowed in because of the brand of boots he was wearing! Are you kidding me?! We thought it was a joke at first, but then realized through his douche bag personality that he was being serious. Let me just explain to you that these were new, clean $150 boots that this happened over ... So, he did not look like a bum, or whatever they were implying. We stood outside waiting for our friend to come out and witnessed a guy go in with cowboy boots, probably 10 girls go in with boots on, and a guy wearing a baseball hat with a hoodie on with the hood of it pulled over his hat all allowed in. When our friend came out he was mad and asked the door guy what the reasoning was, and the door guy put his hands around our friends throat and pushed him and told him he needed to get off of the property! 5 minutes later the police arrived b/c apparently the idiots at McFadden's called them on our friend, and then they proceeded to tell the police that we were "taunting" them because we were standing out front of the bar!!!!! For any McFadden's employees that read this ... Even the police were laughing at what absolute pathetic douche bags you all were for your ridiculous rules!!!  I have never been treated like this, or seen so much disrespect in my life! I hope everyone reads this and refuses to give that place any business!!!

Wow it was so bad  We asked to sit on the patio and no one ever came to ask us if we wanted a drink or bring us water !!! Tables were left dirty on the patio as well .. We got up and left  Went across to whiskey rose and the same thing !! Nobody ever came out . We walked out and so did the table next to us ...no service and no customer service. And they could care less

So I was very skeptical as there were so many bad reviews.....but was glad we tried it out.....this was a super busy night, as this is night 2 of the Taylor Swift concert....traffic wasn't bad headed out this way, parking went pretty smooth, not too crowded....the sign said 30 minute wait (unless we wanted to sit outside) but we got right in...server was very attentive and food came out quickly....pricing wasn't too bad and food was enjoyable....makes me wonder if we went to the same place as others did...lol

This place is disgusting!!!!!! Do not come here for drinks OR food. The place is always dead and it still takes 45 minutes for food to come to the table. The drinks are over priced and they are weak. Hopefully someone will come around and buy out this place and put it out of its misery soon.

I read that they would get my check wrong and sure enough, it was. Wow.  I told her to not even try to explain since I knew it would be an overcharge because they are sort of known to do this.   Wow.  this place is simply not good.  Sorry.
Whats up with this Staind wanna be band on Paddys Day? They arent good for the crowd

Wow.  I went to McFadden's 4 nights ago and I was still amped to blast them on here.  But after reading all the other negative reviews I see I was just another victim of their standard operating procedure.  I went there twice in the last few weeks(Coyote's games) and I'm done.  On the first visit I ordered a Black and Tan.  After receiving what looked like a Guiness with powdered sugar in it and waiting 10 mins for the bar tender to acknowledge, I was informed that they don't have Bass and use something else in their Black and Tans.  Naturally, I asked why this wasn't brought to my attention at the time the drink was ordered.  To which the bartender offered no apology, but replied: "It's on the menu"  Really!?!  First of all a Black and Tan should have separation whatever you use, and second, who uses a menu to order a beer at a bar!?  On the second visit my buddy was told he had won a  free happy hour for ten people, but it was actually a reduced price in drinks.  I don't know what caused the miscommunication but after the way they treated me the first time, they're not getting the benefit of the doubt.  I had about 15 people come from the East side and ended up picking up several rounds to make it worth their trip.  That was just the main peanut in a pile of poor treatment.   The customer service at this place is miserable.  I have no idea how they are staying in business.  That being said, I can concur that the Turkey Club was quite delicious.  That's why I'm giving the place 2 stars.  I suggest getting it to go....

My TWO STARS is because, seating was ample...NOT due to the food, nor service, nor management....  AS YOU MIGHT NOTCIE, I tried this place and wrote a review last year after (Nov 2014) after I did an ONLINE search looking for a '49ers fan' place to enjoy football season.... Not only did I give this place a second chance, but to be fair I came back three weeks in a row!  FIRST! and foremost, according to Joe, the manager on duty ... this is NOT a 49ers bar/restaurant - ummm? then please remove it from the list!. Joe says the GM likes the 49ers, but Joe will decide what games (sound) is on the big screen...   1st week Nov. 2015: food was room temp., Joe (manager in charge) made accommodations for the food.   Not many patrons but lots of waitstaff ... standing around chatting under the big screen... I would think that with that many employees, the individual guest attention would have been MUCH better.  "49er VIP section" empty, and told its for PAY only.  2nd week Nov. 2015: asked to sit in the  '49er VIP section' with a large screen... was told, you have to pay. Waited and watched while others came in and sat there.... Ordered shepard pie (barely room temp.) Again, lots of waitstaff standing around chatting with each other... continually waited for service. We pointed out the chicken bone where we had moved the chair from... our server said 'oh, that happens all the time'... um?  3rd week Nov 8. 2015:  upon entering asked again about the VIP seating... The host said NO, you have to pay for that seating. Asked, Joe about sitting there and he said 'paying/reserved  is only on Friday and Saturday night, YES, go ahead and sit there, I will let the hostess' know'.... he went over and corrected the hostess'. Again, lots of wait staff.... our server was pleasant. Instead of bringing Corona Light for the 2nd & 3rd beer, regular Corona's were delivered ... got that straightened out. Mosquitos were galore in this VIP seating area and we kept fighting them off, even asked if they had a spray we could use. There were only three of us in the VIP seating with large screen... asked if the sound could be turned on THIS TV or if the sound in the restaurant could be changed to the 49ers, again after reading ONLINE that this is restaurant was listed as a 49ers location... it is NOT!!! Joe, the manager adamantly told our server he is NOT putting the sound on for the 49ers... during half-time, I went to the bar where Joe was making drinks and asked, nicely, for him to help me understand.... why the 49ers sound was not and could not be played, if this restaurant is a  49ers sports bar?  Still preparing drinks and walking away, barely giving me any attention, stated that the GM is a 49er fan and he Joe, is not, and that he (Joe) puts the sound on for what he thinks will be the GAME OF THE DAY... as I had already studied the patrons (less than 15 people inside) none of which were following the Bronco vs Colts game.... I pointed this out to Joe, he stated ... I am NOT changing the TVs.... very sad.... He said we could call when the games are playing to check to see what sound/game will be playing...  Very very sad....  Sadly, this restaurant has potential... if the cooks could get the orders right, the waitstaff could deliver it before it is cool (and less chatting with other employees) and decide whether or not they are a 49ers bar ... I think they need BAR RESCUE ... before its' too late... and they join the ranks of other fallen bars/restaurant...
I am not ok with a bar asking women to get off of their seat to make room for more people. Customer service is not priority here.

DO NOT GO HERE! The servers are thieves! Alissa C added money to her tip. When you call to speak to a manager, the hostess tells you they are in a meeting and the manager never returns your call. Garbage establishment.

What a jerk the guy checking ID's is. I'm a 57 YO guy and when I asked why he needed to see my ID he said, "because I said so."  I'm guessing the place got in trouble for underage drinking and they require the guys to check everyone.

Was in to watch some Sunday football today and the bartender's changed shifts at 4pm so we cashed out. No problem.  Had great service and bartender was very friendly.  2nd shift bartender "not so much".   When the bill came we pointed out to him that we were overcharged for our drinks and they were the EXACT same drinks we had with the first bartender.  We first confirmed there was NO happy hour just to make sure that wasn't the reason for the price increase.  Bartender says to us ...and I quote "I don't know what deal you had with the other bartender but these are the prices in the register so I don't know what to tell you" Excuse me?  We had our receipt right there and we didn't know the 1st bartender from Adam , there was "no deal" and you need to make this right.  Overcharged $8.  Go somewhere else.  Why get ripped off? I'm sure you all work for your money too:)
The food here is great. But the waitress that dance on the bars are ugly. The Asian one is hot and hooks me up with free drinks.

Dear reviewers reading, Went here last night after Whiskey Rose was shutting down for the night it was only 12 am and a lot of people were looking for more drinks good thing this place stayed open. Everything was super great the bartender put together a sex on the beach drink and there's is sweeter than Whiskey Rose which surprised me. A lot of normal drunks hanging out trying to talk and laugh. Nothing unusual next time I'll try the dance floor when its a Friday or Saturday night.

This is located in Westgate, personally i thinknthe place is ok, to watch a game. The beer is normally just average and the food DO NOT EAT, we have tryed 3 different items and they are awful. Like i said its ok to watch a game and thats about.

We are visiting from Seattle and went to this restaurant tonight with friends. It was an absolutely terrible experience.   The service was incredibly slow and unattentive. We waited about 40 minutes for our food to come and we only ordered 3 appetizers to share. Our drinks took a good 10 minutes to arrive and when we asked for extra sauce or a drink refill, it never came. As we looked around, we noticed many other tables scanning the room looking for their servers as well.    The food itself was disgusting. I'd compare it to gas station cuisine only it was served on a china plate and we paid 4 times as much for it. We ordered the "Irish Nachos" which was supposed to be crispy fries with melted cheese and other typical nacho toppings. What we got were soggy steak fries (which also ended up coming with the two other appetizers we ordered-fry overload!) soaked in fake cheese sauce with some dried up chunks of tomato. The boneless wings looked and tasted like they were straight out of a frozen package and the sliders must have have been brought over from the local fast food joint...actually, I would have preferred a fast food burger to the measly meat patty on stale bread that we were served.   We ended up cancelling the next round of drinks that we had ordered and left very unsatisfied. An Applebees would have been a serious step up from McFadden's. DO NOT EAT HERE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!
Nice place, good service...but...it sucks that everyone by passes this place to go to the Sandbar for weak drinks and horrible service. Hoping the best for this place!!

This review is for the night scene here, I have never ate here/been here during the day.    This place has a lot of potential but the security/staff kills the vibe.  It's just typical Glendale bar BS where they kick everyone out for "looking drunk"/just not liking you.  Other people I've talked to have had similar experiences here.  Even though they have a DJ and go-go dancers on the bar, you should not dance because they will kick you out for that too.  One time a bartender poured me a beer that was all head and then just gave it to me like that was normal.  I noticed that in the past year it has gone from being relatively crowded every Friday/Saturday night to almost empty whenever I walk by.  Based on that and the fact that the yelp rating is so low, I'm guessing that I'm not the only one who has had a bad time here.    I don't know who is in charge of the staff for all these bars at Westgate, but they should probably re-evalute their training and policies or else nobody is going to want to come back again. It's not like it's even cheap to go out there, and they try to charge a cover every weekend.  I live on the west side, but I'll gladly spend another $15 to take an uber downtown instead of having to put up with bad customer service and the threat of having security kick me out suddenly when I'm just minding my own business and trying to chill out.

We are Seahawk fans and wanted to come to this so-called Seahawks bar to watch the Superbowl to be with other Hawks fans. Here was our experience:  1) We paid $105 per person for standing space since the place was fully booked. It said the price included a buffet of food. They had a couple trays of nachos and wings for hundreds of people.   2) Waiting in line was so confusing. We were supposed to have access to it from 4pm-end of the game. Waited for an hour; fought through the line to ask the host, he had no clue of what was going on and said we were in the right line. Found out later that we were in the walk-in line, not the line with people who had reserved a spot (this was a blob of people, not a line). We finally fought our way into the bar.  3) Whenever the Patriots scored, someone blew a horn.. Seahawks bar?? Not to mention some Pats fan (a guy) pushed me when I fought my way to the bathroom.  4) When we lost the game, they played the song "We are the Champions".. WTF. I would rather they just slap me in the face directly.  The whole experience was awful. At some point some punk Patz fan threw (Yes, he really threw it!) a tray of unfinished food on a large table of Seahawk fans and then wanted to fight. Sauces and food went flying everywhere and got on people's shirt. After the game, not only they trash talked, they also took off their shirts (the guys) and flung it around and wanted to fight.   The whole reason we picked a Hawks bar was because we want to be with other real Hawks fans. This is a flip-flopping bar. Whoever wins, they support. Overpriced, overcrowded, rude staff. Never again...
I'd come back every night for the sexy Asian dancing on the bar! Drinks were ok, not very strong, but other than that, very cool environment. They gave away free shots! Definitely would go again.

A small group of us ate here before an event over at the stadium and it was terrible. There were a few issues that we had throughout our dinning experience but what really ruined it for me was the food and the way it was handled.  I ordered the Beef sliders, which is listed on the menu as "topped with caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, and chipotle ranch on brioche buns".  What came out though was a very sad and flat looking patty on a bun with a tiny dot of chipotle sauce. I pointed this out to the waitress and asked where the rest of the toppings are, most impotently the caramelized onions, she told me that they were out of them!   If they are out of the toppings then why wouldn't they tell me this? Our event was about to start at the stadium so I didn't have time to order anything else, not that they even asked me if I would like to.  So I ate the Beef Sliders and they were horrible, the patties were too dry, thin, and plain. I had to cover them in A1 sauce to eat them.   Of course I was still charged and paid full price for these sad Beef Sliders even though they didn't come as advertised.   With the over all dinning experience I can see now why everywhere else around the stadium had a wait and this place didn't.
They like the Chickenhawks..they must suck..stay away! Anyplace that doesn't favor the home team sucks!

My family and I attended the final four games this past Saturday and Monday and spent our pre-game time at McFaddens.  We had a wonderful experience; between discussions with Scott (manager) regarding reserving a table prior to the events, to being greeted and escorted to our tables promptly upon arrival by Mariah, to Mariah helping my 70 year old mother find a stool with a seatback and adjusting our table location, and with wonderful service from both Kelsey and Liz both days. We had a very enjoyable and pleasant experience with all of their staff, including people not mentioned here simply because we did not catch their names. I will definitely be making McFadden's our go-to location before Cardinals games, the Fiesta Bowl, and any other events in the area.  Thank you.

Probably the absolute worst customer service I have ever received and that was before we got in!! Not only did they make my friend take his hat off but he couldn't just hold onto it. They wanted him to go put it in the truck!! I'm telling everyone I know not to waste their time here. So hypocritical because there was a guy on the patio with a hat on and when we asked they said "it's ok he's an older gemtleman" you kidding me?? I thought  we were going to an Irish pub, but this place is trying to make itself a night club. Then after waiting in line for a while to get into what seemed to be a packed place, we get in and the place is empty. Come on McFadden's get serious.

We stopped here after working a show at the Phoenix stadium on a Sunday night. Beers were cold and the service was good. My wife and I had burgers that were ordered medium. When they came out they are obviously frozen patti burgers and were over cooked to well done. Now that I have read the reviews I wish we had not gone their. Better choices around the corner. It sounds like I need to watch my card for extra charges from earlier posts.

I swear I think one of the bouncers stole my wallet. Luckily I had nothing in there. There are also bouncers in the bathrooms being weirdo's... Unfortunately for us, a group of 6, my girlfriend decided to be brave and wear big heels.. We all know girls, sometimes they fail to take the wrong step, any who.. she stumbled a little, but not even a significant amount to call her drunk.. They ended up kicking her out LOL..   Did I mention? She was D.D that night....  NEGATIVE 10 STARS   GO LOOK AT ALL THE REVIEWS AND SEE HOW MANY PEOPLE GOT KICKED OUT FOR NO REASON. I will never go to this place again....

Ummmmmmm not the best thing that has ever happened to me, but fun for a girls night out.  I would not recommend this place for a date-- it seems to be better for groups and hoes.  Yeah, definitely groups and hoes.  I have never tried the food here. Ever.  This last time there was no cover since a buddy did the happy hour route-- which is: if you have like 8 people total, give them your name and guarantee those people will be there, they will give you a "host bracelet" and free drink coupons, and the rest of your group will get bracelets which gives them $2 well drinks and $2 beer (nothing fancy, so you've got to like Bud Light)  It is right across from this country themed bar with a mechanical bull, so that's a fun distraction for a while... but it's not like either of these places are Vegas-class or anything.  additionally...  Do NOT drink and drive. Like ever. But ESPECIALLY from this place-- there are cops EVERYWHERE. Cops standing right outside the doors looking for the drunkies... cop cars parked all over the parking lot.  Don't be afraid to get into the passenger seat of your car, toss those keys into the backseat and take a niiice looonnng nap until you're sober, or someone comes to pick you up.   ENJOY!

This is a nice spot if you don't want to wait the hour it normally takes to get a table at Yard House (which should be your first option in Westgate). It's noisy and it's loud with all the hockey fans and hockey games on all of their screens. Being a hockey fan myself, I do enjoy that atmosphere, but I know it's not for everyone. Go Coyotes!

Worse bar EVER! I got kick out for nothing and for the wrong guys?WTF? They told me that "I was asking girls to flash" and I told them I just got in.  I remember the guy that kicked me out. I want to sue the place for hear/say. I am a criminal justice student and they didn't prove it was me. I spent over 200 plus in this bar, wish I didn't,  because it was my friend birthday. I will be back and there will be some talk with the BOSS.   THEN AGAIN WORSE BAR EVER!  People if you're going to have a birthday party... DON'T

You know how you get those certificates on restaurants.com for places that are trying to drum up business? Well, the question is usually, "Is it because nobody has heard of the place or because it's just that bad?"  In this instance, it was the latter. They only have what, 5 real entrees on the menu, and couldn't serve 2 of them; 1 was out and another wasn't prepped.  The food didn't taste bad but was far from impressive. The Shepherds Pie was bland and was made with canned peas and carrots and plain ground beef, and the corned beef was dry and had little to no seasoning. At least the bread pudding was good. The bathroom had no soap in any of the four dispensers nor paper towels in either of theirs. I suppose the best thing I can say is that at least half of what we got was free thanks to the certificate we got online.  I feel bad for the poor server who looked pretty embarrassed when she repeatedly had to tell us what they couldn't serve.
Can I say two words...DRINK MENU!!  You would make so much more money if you had one!   Drink recommended by server was WEAK!!!

If you're a SF 49er fan this is your spot on game day. Lots of energy & fans.  We wandered in on a Sunday Fun Day after having not been in over a year& had fun because of the crowd.
