The list goes down 50/50 with goods/bads but the bads for me because of what they are & where they are located @ Westgate won't have me darkening their door again for another year or so because food can improve & so can cleanliness but this bar hasn't yet so that's why I'm mentioning it finally.   Goods -Jameson on special all day every day - bartenders quick  - DJ on the weekends  Bad - The food is Meh at best - Ladies bathroom had toilet water on floor, no tp in holder & soap MIA on a primetime Sunday Football Game day - Wants to be a club on the weekends & charges a cover

We usually end up here because we are able to grab a quick bite to eat or drink before a coyotes game or cardinals game. However, tonight I just got served the worst burger of my life. It was like a hockey puck honestly. Order something else the nachos as an appetizer we're okay. Just stay away from the rock solid burgers. :(

McFadden's is a fun place to grab a beer before Coyotes games during the week. It has a good vibe and the servers are all really nice. For the west valley, it is what it is. Don't know why people are complaining. We just go, get a beer, and then go to the game.

If i could give a negative star it would be negative 100!!!  Worst place ever!!! They over charged then blamed us for not reading menu when we were right? Do not come here!! Who chargers $13 for chips and salsa? And this was the manager and bartender who both need to learn to talk and not yell at customer's then walled away. Such dumb ass people. So yeah never again will go to this bar or recommend this place! I'll pay arena prices at hockey game!

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL. Meathead bartender ? I guess. ? Walks up and escalates issue needlessly. Totally uncalled for and ridiculous. Next time I go, NO eats. Sip at a time & tip at a time.  HORRIBLE service by night crew. 6ish MST. #hopefired

we had dinner there on 7/20/11. we both had the shepards pie. what a joke! irish grandmothers are rolling in their graves. it tasted like stew out of a can together with instant mashes potatoes. we need to make them change their name because that's about the only thing irish about this pitiful place. $15 for a shepard's pie that left us hungry afterwards! we were so hungry later we had happy meals to fill us up!

Food was so-so. Service a big fat F-... three couples joined us for dinner. We each ordered at separate times. One order took 45 minutes. One order arrived after 10 minutes. Two orders never arrived. We asked for check to leave and they attempted to charge us for everything and tried arguing that we just wanted to skip on the bill.

DO NOT GO TO MCFADDEN'S in Westgate Mall (AZ)!! If you plan on attending the NCAAF National Championship game in Glendale, AZ - please watch the video at this link: http://www.abc15.com/news/region-west-valley/glendale/mcfaddens-at-westgate-questioned-about-credit-card-fraud?autoplay=true ! My family/friends and I were there a couple weeks ago and several of our group had credit card information stolen (and multiple cross-country charges were made) after using the cards at McFadden's in Westgate. They refuse to rectify the situation, and have made excuse after excuse about it... so a news team from ABC15 took up the case. Reading some of the other recent reviews, this is not the first time this has happened. Such a disappointment for all of us.

This place really is what the reviews say. Napkin throwing didn't get any reaction but they kept doing it. I just had to laugh because it was just like the reviews. I think if I was a bar noobie at 21 I would have loved it because there was lots of people out to have a fun time and the atmosphere was really hype. I would never go back because I can't justify paying for alcohol served in small plastic cups- I'm a grown man. But I can't say I didn't have a great time dancing with my friends- because we did.

Our group ate here during the day on a Sunday and expected to get reasonable service, reasonable food in reasonable amount of time. What we received was horrible service, nasty food and a hellish wait for it. Yes I know McFadden's primary service is that of a sports bar, but I can name 20 sports bars around the valley providing much better service and food. People are still paying for service and food and should be treated as such.   The Sunday we went we had went around 1pm. We were waiting to be seated by the hostess who had her purse slung around her shoulder as she was ready to leave. She said "Well, I guess I can seat you". Sorry, all we wanted to do was pay for lunch and drinks. Sorry for the inconvenience. We were sat in a section with about 2 other tables (the bar and restaurant was 'dead') and thought to ourselves, this should be quick. WRONG.   We ordered drinks and it took about 15 minutes to receive them. Then we put our order in. We had ordered items off of the happy hour (chicken strips and soup) and a sandwich. It took 45 MINUTES to receive these items. The Irish Potato Soup was separating and it looked like it had been maturing under a heat lamp for about 30 minutes. The French Dip sandwich was dry as a bone. Despite complaining about both of these items they were not taken off of our bill.   As we walked out I warned a couple going in to make sure they have hours of time to waste if they want food. The guy asked if I was serious due to the small amount of people inside. I reaffirmed him and he and his girl were on their way elsewhere. The least I could do was prevent someone else from experiencing McFadden's service and food. Do yourself a favor and go to one of the other restaurants in Westgate City Center, McFadden's doesn't deserve your patronage.

Can't recommend this place to anyone. The staff treats you as if they are doing you a favor to serve you, the food is less than typical bar style food, and I challenge the cleanliness standards. Get a sandwich from the gas station that's close by, you'll be happier with the food quality and their gas pumps are cleaner than McFadden's bathrooms.

Was so nervous to come here after reading the reviews, but IGNORE them!!! Came here on St. Pattys day and it was a blast!! Our food was good, atmosphere was awesome!! If you're looking for a fun atmosphere with good food this is the place! Service was also great as well! Do not get what the bad reviews are about!

My husband and I got a real night out and wanted to go dancing. I had seen the bar on Saturday (for Halloween) but there was a line so long, I knew I wasn't getting in haha we came back this Wednesday and were not disappointed. The atmosphere was amazing, the bartender was generous and cool, the security guards were on point, and their DJ knew how to get people moving. I drank more than I could handle,  (as I am a new drinker and had never been drunk). I didn't know my limit. They took care of me and made sure my husband got us home safe. I think this is my main spot now.

This place disappoints more & more. It's so pathetic now that they have the staff dress like prostitutes to try& get any business. Sad!  So empty.... Hopefully they shut down soon so something better can open up.

I wish that I could give this place negative stars. My son, my boyfriend, my best friend and I came to get some lunch. I'll start by saying that the appeal of this place is on point. I am Irish. I was excited to find an Irish pub/restaurant. I was horribly disappointed by what we experienced.   Upon entering we were sat by a female I could only assume was the hostess. She informed us our "server" would be with us shortly. We waited, used the rest room, took photos and read the entire, less then impressive one page menu. We were finally greeted by our waitress and she took our drink orders. I said waters all around and my boyfriend and I ordered beers. 20 min went by and we finally got our beers. No water. My friend orders her beer after she returned from the rest room and another 20 min goes by and she finally gets her beer. Still no water. We waited and waited for her to return and take our food order and bring the waters. My boyfriend finally got up and asked where our waters were and if we would be able to place our food orders. A few minutes after he sat back down the "hostess" comes over and slams four waters on the table, didn't say a word just slammed them all down and walked away. I shouted "THANK YOU" and she didn't even knowledge me. Our waitress came and took our food order, which consisted of some appetizers and a kids burger, didn't write anything down and walked away.   We sat there for another 20 minutes. After watching the family next to us get there food and drinks promptly we decided that we no longer wanted to wait there for the crap service to get worse so we paid for our drinks and left. I wrote a note on my sons kids menu that read, "horrible service" left that next to the 12$ for our beers and waters and we took our business elsewhere.   This place has potential, I was honestly excited to find a nice Irish bar and restaurant. obviously the management isn't managing ANYTHING, and the criteria for wait and bar staff is bottom barrel. Being attractive doesn't make you a good waitress/hostess. A good attitude and a passion for great customer service are things this place and its employees are seriously lacking.

Quiet possibly THE WORST restaurant on the planet.   Should've seen the red flags when this place was empty and everything else nearby was an hour plus wait.  Food overpriced and horrible.....presentation of the "chicken sandwich" made me depressed...looked like waitress dropped it on floor then, after a quick trip through the dishwasher/blender, it ended up on a plate and served to lucky me.  Worse part is how overpriced their garbage is--daylight robbery.  Entire wait staff was on the rag.  Not only was the music absolutely horrid, their volume goes to 11!  #disaster

This place pretty much sucks. Been forced to come here twice due to the lines at the other restaurants and bars at Westgate having over an hour wait. We didn't have to wait here and I can see why! People know better than to come. Calling this place an "Irish Pub" is like calling my Chrysler a Porche. There isn't one Irish thing about it, except they serve Guinness. Big whoop! Almost all bars do. The service is terrible and everyone seems to have a major 'tude. Gee sorry for interrupting your social time of you chatting away with your buddies on the staff. The food is average in taste I guess. There were ZERO veg options so I had 3 sides, which was interesting. Everyone else's food seemed okay, except for my husband who ordered honey medium wings and they were making ME sweat just sitting next to him. He suffered through them, but was for sure not what were ordered. When we mentioned it to our server she basically gave us a blank look and did nothing. We had quite a few drinks here before a concert thinking it would save a little money from buying 11 dollar beers in the arena. How wrong were we!? Plus, they ran out of pint glasses and had to use plastic. The place was maybe half full? We split our check in half for the 2 couples and my mouth hit the floor! 75 bucks was HALF!?! For 3 sides, an entree, 3 wines and 3 beers. Just...wow. Lastly we were in this awkward table that lined square up to the server station, and made me feel really claustrophobic sitting inches from this giant awkward wall.  I read in some reviews this place turns into a club later at night! This made me LOL literally. I can't even imagine. Save your money and pride and stay the hell away from here. Seriously.  I have to say, the management must not care. 99 percent of these reviews are horrible and nothing has been done. Oh well, guess they will learn when they shut down, because I can't imagine that's far away!

Smells like stank old stinky beer from right when we came in. Couldn't mix Manhattan or a car bomb. They got the beer right. Manhattan was undrinkable car bomb was missing Jameson. Gave us the wrong ticket and just charged a different amount for a different ticket without saying anything went up another $15. We talked to the manager and he gave us a dollar off on a $40 ticket.

Sub par. I knew I should have just listened to the other reviews, but I had to see what was true. Had the blt, not bad, but cold fries. Honestly, you can't screw up a blt, but McFaddens did. Cheap pub grub, at 10 bucks a plate... Sorry ass place, dead lunch crowd. Seems like the only thing that keeps it in business is the  booze.
DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS... You want HORRIBLE food, mistake after mistake on your orders and service that is worse than the food.

Came here for a VIP event and Id have to say that's was the best all around experience I've had at west gate. Brianna was our server and she went above and beyond for everyone in my group. The music was good and the crowd was friendly. If you haven't stopped by here yet its definitely a place to visit.

It's a sports bar.  Several of the TVs are messed up and the infield dirt is the same color as the grass and all the people are green. The guy said someone sprayed Champaign on the HDMI cords.  Stupid and weak.

Mcfadden's? An IRISH Bar? In name only. Didn't eat here - met a friend for drinks and to watch some sports - He was in town staying @ the Marriott next door. Anyway, high prices for drinks and what really makes me laugh is the "Nightclub" it transforms into...Again an IRISH Bar becomes a night club? The transformation started by taking away all of the chairs around the bar and then abruptly shutting off power to 90% of there TV's - in mid game!   At first I was a little pissed but, I honestly just laughed as we got our bill. It really was a joke! I will say the bartenders were very good and the gals were very hot - especially the plaid stripper skirt the one bartender changed into and gave us all a nice view every time she went into the lower coolers for beers! Thank You...  Overall, I will pass. Many better options in Westgate. Unless you are a 20-something guy looking for a late night sausage fest - then it might be for you....
The most disgusting shepherds pie on the planet! Service sucked, prices were ridiculous drinks were watered-down. Who's  running this place? Will never be returning!

Reserved a table for Saturday Night before game.  Paid $200 online.  They refused to let my 22 year old cousin in due to his ID being from out of state and vertical and that apparently is against the law in AZ.  Even with a long line, they refused to refund us for the table that we did not use.    Besides that, heard from several people that they raised prices to Vegas level $45 for a double absolut diet.  Were not truly a Seahawk bar and also did not deliver on promised rallies=)     I will tell anyone I know going to Phoenix to avoid this badly managed bar!

I wish I could give this 0 stars. I met up a girl here to have a Guinness. I had one, she had one. I order her a shot. The bartender said she couldn't serve us anymore because she put her head on my shoulder. Yeah, cuz it was 1 in the morning on a monday and she was tired. She called security and he escalated the situation and then the police were called. Over a shot. I hope this place catches on fire. I am embarrassed that Guinness is served here. Not only that, the bartenders don't even properly pour it.

Slightly better than Whiskey Rose but that ain't saying much.  At least the bartender and waitresses acknowledge you here and force a smile out.  The place is a mess with napkins and beer spilled all over.  There are a bunch of idiots that patron this place but they should at least clean up a little.  No idea about the food or anything else.

Well I was worried coming here after all the bad reviews. I was meeting people for the Ama motor cross ...westgate was packed. But we only had a 15 min. Wait the waitress was attentive and she told us what to not order to avoid a long wait. I had the shepards pie. It really wasn't that bad , not mind blowing but not your typical bar food . One friend ordered the wings and he liked them the other got a burger, he said it wasn't too bad either . I would give them another try. I hope the other reviewers who said their cc info was stolen work out... Yikes .

This place SUCKSSSSSSSS. Drinks are expensive and they charge a cover sometimes. A cover!?!? Idk if they still but last time I was there they did and I was like wtf. Only paid it cuz a few friends were inside already but never again.   Service is horrible and then they allow people to dance on the bars which was gross and almost knocked over my drink. Skip this place.

I could go anywhere from 1 to 5 on this place.  First, they have a new menu with prices that are more aligned to what is normal and reasonable.  I've always liked their food.  Last visit I got the fish and chips.  They really aren't chips, they are shoestring and I had to send them back for being cold.  We got an appetizer that was supposed to be 50% off but they charged us $5.50, original price was $7, so half of 7 is 3.50.  Had to bring that to their attention.  Service was good, but we've never had a service issue here.  The ugh.  The place is looking tired.  The booth we were at had a slit in the bench-pretty significant.  The place looked a little dirty.  If they can get it fixed up and cleaned with the new menu and food I think they will be full again.  So McFadden's is on our keep list-just need to keep working out little things.  However, the biggest thing that kept us from making a frequent place was $21 for bangers and mash which are now priced at $13.

Hit McFadden's last night at Westgate when there was no game at the arena.  The service was great but the food was horrible.  We got the tater tots.  When they came to the table I asked what was supposed to be so special about them.  I was told they are tater tots and that was what they were.  I will save my $10 and cook them at home next time.  We got the BBQ burger to split.  The hamburger was something I would expect from the school cafeteria and bacon on top was obviously cooked a couple days ago and kept in the warmer.  When we sent it back the waitress politely told us that she didn't think they would do anything since we had eated over half it.  I pointed out we each had 1 bite to confirm one of use wasn't being too picky. Sounds like they have a bunch of food sent back. They did end up removing it from the bill. The Onion rings were good but that is it.  It is too bad I bought a reward package to this restaurant before checking it out.  Going to check out the one in Scottsdale.  Hoping it is much better.

Basically, they don't give a crap.   Dirty, horrible service, watered down well drinks,  and the food was awful.  I don't even know why they bother serving food.  The servers aren't interested in serving it and the cooks could give a damn about what they throw on a plate.   I wouldn't go back if I was starving.

If there were a negative Or a minus star that's what I would rate it. Please do not waste your time here, the staff is so unprofessional, from their security to their managers. Had a security guard call me a "bitch and a motherfucker" for no reason, and when confronted with the manager at the time he instead of fixing the problem decided to impersonate me, it was really all a circus. They have clowns trying to lead other clowns, please avoid this place if you want to have a good time.

My fiancee and I were on a date and trying to decide where to eat. Neither one of us have ever been to McFaddens so we decided to try it. Worst decision we made. There was no one in the restaurant which now after leaving makes sense. We sat down and had to wait 10 minutes before having our drink orders taken. The place is infested with mosquitos. We were sitting there talking and just kept getting bit. When we finally got our drinks, they were in small plastic cups and my fiancees root beer tasted like seltzer water. We decided to just cancel our food and leave. We told the hostess we wanted to pay for the soda and leave. She said she told our server but our server avoided us at all cost. We finally got sick of waiting and went to the bar to pay but the manager took care of it. I made she contact with our server before we left and she just walked away without saying a word to us. If I could this review no stars, I would. This was the worst service we have ever received and will not be going back to this place.

I was in the area for business last week and came into McFadden's for lunch on Tuesday. It wasn't too busy and I didn't have any issues with service or prices- both were great, in my opinion.  I ordered the Reuben and it was fantastic. The sandwich was huge, piled high with corned beef and kraut. The bread was toasted perfectly and didn't get soggy which was a MAJOR plus.   I also had the bread pudding, because duh. If it's on the menu I have to order it, so I did, and YUM. The caramel whiskey sauce knocked my socks off, and the consistency of the bread pudding was great. I'm not sure where all these crappy reviews came from, but maybe they have a new kitchen staff or something?  Either way, I'll be back the next time I'm in Glendale.

This is my third time here.  Every time it gets worse.  Their food is mediocre,  service is non existing.  Today is Saturday,  they have no specials.  We end up here because everything else is busy. And this is why, poor service and food that is so so at best.  The place is falling apart, the bathrooms are missing faucets  everything is barely ok.  This is the last time we spend time and money here, even my biker BF that spends time at sketchy bars is dissatisfied .  Such a waste

Been here a couple of times before and was ambivalent about food, drinks, & service, everything was just ok. Most recent visit my food & drinks were again ok, but others in my party were dissatisfied. In addition, service was so abysmal that the manager took off 50% off the bill for our entire party of 15. Who can stay in business doing that? I don't understand why servers are not better trained. There is no excuse for not providing a better customer experience! Also, do something about the disgusting restrooms!

To me this is a Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde establishment.  Sometimes it's fine and other times, it's scary. For big events this place can be the place to be. The Seahawks take it over for away games in Phoenix. Ohio State took over for the football playoffs. My Gonzaga friends had fun there for the final four. Without big time events, this place is dog shit. Went in on a normal Wednesday night during old car night and there were about 4 people in the place. Sat at the bar 10 minutes with no bartender in sight. 2 cocktail waitresses stood in the service area totally ignoring our presence. The bartender finally surfaced and was an ass hole. Got a beer and moved to the patio where we were again invisible. Sat with empty glasses as a waitress wiped down some tables not seeing our hails for more beer. Hint - look at the customers. Those tables aren't going anywhere. Especially when there are 4 people in the place. Try to sell something! We shouldn't have to beg for service. There are 4 people in the place!  We finally got a beer and put a $20 down for the $12 dollar tab and the inattentive waitress actually asked us if we wanted change? No, Honey, we're dying to tip you $8.00 for being completely shitty. You and the ass hole bartender.   Next time I stopped in for a non-event beer, the place stunk so bad with a sewer smell, we left. Hostess said they had a "deep cleaning" the day before and that was the smell. They must have deep cleaned the sewer.  Maybe this place makes enough money on the special events at the stadium, hockey arena and Westgate to keep in business cause I don't see it on an everyday basis. The place sucks.
good drink specials. the riff raff seems to come out about 10:30-11 o'clock.

If I could I would give the place negative stars. The staff was EXTREMELY rude not just one but all 5+ that we encountered. It was not for a lack of trying on our part... We were friendly tried to make conversation and tipped well but still couldn't even get a smile out of the staff.  The later you are at this place the more questionable the crowd becomes. Felt VERY unsafe. I will never return and have told all my friends to do the same. Sucks to have to post such a negative review.

$52 with tip for 2 bud lights and 2 things of wings. I saw low reviews before going and thought I'd just try it cause it's St. Patrick's Day.   No matter what holiday it is I won't be back. They are too proud of their boneless wings. The sauce was tasteless. I can get literally the same wings/chicken nuggets at Sonic for 1/5 the price.   For 2 green bud lights it was $16! Ridiculous.

Went here before a hockey game, and got wings and a local beer, I think it was the Kiltlifter.  The prices were reasonable, the wings were just spicy enough, and the beer was good.  The beer was recommended by a bartender when I told him that I usually drink Stone or Sam Adams.  Can't complain.

The service was fine,  the food was tasteless. I've never had fried mozzarella that had no flavor or seasoning. We tried to order surf and turf but they WERE OUT OF STEAK. Who puts steak on the menu and let's it run out.  The fries were like McDonald's fries with no salt. We will not be going back.

Snitch ass bar with bitch ass tendencies. Been coming here for 4 years. Cought my best friends boyfriend on a date with another woman. Told my friend. He starts snapping on me. And I get put out like a drunkard even though I'm sober and have a winning fish. Because he told security if she comes up to me kick her out. I was just trying to use the bathroom.  The punk ass DJ don't even know who Janelle Monae is. On dirty computer night. Pathetic. And second time I've been mistreated by this bar and they kept my five dollars for the fish. Needs to go out of business to make room for a real bar. #getdaterapedhere #djstrappedinthe90s #looserassracistasssecurity

Not a great place to go before a Coyote's game, despite its prime location. As usual, Yard House had a ridiculous wait and McFadden's patio was empty so we headed over there...mistake. Go eat and drink anywhere else. Their service was atrocious and the food/prices don't make up for it. Despite being deserted, we were given a buzzer thing to wait for a table (told a 20 minute wait). We went and sat at the outside bar, which only has 3 beers on tap. After waiting for 45 minutes, we checked in at the front to see how much longer it would be. The lady said she had been calling our names over the microphone...clearly the microphone doesn't work in their outdoor space and the buzzer thing never buzzed. The hostess then told us the buzzers don't work...why give it out then? And why not get us from the bar? Having clearly requested an outdoor table, we were seated indoors. The menu is small and doesn't have much of anything interesting. We ordered onion rings, and a lot of beers. The onion rings came out immediately and based on their sogginess, they obviously had just been sitting out in the kitchen. Beers weren't poured great (small pours).
I had the Shepard's pie for the first time..... Amazing! Great service! I can't recommend this bar and restaurant enough. Very impressed!
I've only been here when its a "club" so no review on the food. On a friday and sat night this place is packed...plus only place i know where i can dance on the bar.

I usually like coming to McFadden's at night for some drinks and I'd have to say my favorite bartender is probably Anela! She gets your drinks out fast and always is very friendly. So when I see her work I only go up to her!
Love this place! Great bar food, and just had the new pizza. Can't believe a bar has this good pizza! It will be recommend to all my friends and family. Thanks for the service too!

I went with friends to Westgate Center after a mediocre dinner at Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville, we were wanting to check out the different bars in the center, and came upon McFadden's, it had a line, and it seemed to be happening, so we waited 5 minutes and got in, i was surprised i had to pay a $5 cover but i was okay with that and expected it to be crowded inside but was dismayed that it was only half full, it smelled like dried puke, and it was a total skeeze! ick!   most of the crowd looked bad, and the bar girls in their skimpy outfits did not deserve to wear the outfit. Skimpy isn't bad as long as you fit the image, and these girls did not. Skimpy uniforms work in tempe and old town because you have women that look good for the most part. here the bargirls were tatted up and just didn't look right. Oh and what's with throwing napkins up in the air to act as confetti? it's stupid, and messy, and so the overall appearance of this bar is that it's dirty, with napkins on the floor, spilled beer, some weird funky pukey smell, and the oddest looking crowd. part of me wished i got my $5 back because that was a $3 experience or less. oh and the music was just bad. this is where djs with very little experience must play and practice their skills.   so, to sum it up, it's a hole, and if this is one of the hottest spots Westgate has to offer then someone must have punk'd me coz this is a true joke.

A nearly properly poured Guinness on a Cardinal game day. What could be better. Good service and beer selection in a made-to-sort-of-look-like-Irish-pub. A plethora of TVs to watch whatever you need to see....if you can take your eyes off the cute waitresses.

FOOD REVIEW: sittin at the bar across the 'road' from mcfaddens, a guy in our group went to grab food, specifically molly tots and chicken nachos. Nachos were for me, chicken was cold, cheese ws melted but cold and chewy, chips soggy from the cold cheese. Should've waited to throw together my nachos till the tots were done. First and last time I get food here.

My girlfriend and I are 49er fans and we had heard that there was a very cool 49er club that gathers there so we went to check it out last Sunday. We invited some other friends, most of whom are Cardinal fans. The plan was (as it is every week) to spend the day there enjoying football, food and drink. The food was mediocre at best. The drinks were watered down. Service was slow but we stayed because we had good seats. There were about eight of us. We arrived about 2pm. At 6pm we decided to leave and paid our tab and tipped well despite weak food, drink and service. Half of our group got up and left and the other half started a new conversation. We decided to have one more beer before leaving while we finished our conversation. We ordered, only to have the waitress return a few minutes later (not the waitress that had served us earlier) and tell us that they had decided not to serve us because we had been there too long already and they felt we had had to much to drink. The manager stood behind her. I asked them if we had acted inappropriately in any way to lead them to this decision. They said no. I asked if we were being loud or belligerent. They said no. So i asked, "why are you treating us this way?" And they said it's our opinion that you've been here to long. That was their only reply. I had never had anything like that happen to me before. I told them that we had never been there before and were there to checkout a club that gathers there and brings them plenty of business. The manager, a younger kid who called himself, "Sam" said he didn't care because he doesn't like that club anyway.  I thought, "wow, people go there and spend large amounts of money to be treated that way?" We will never return to this dump and will tell that story to anyone that mentions going there ever again.

Poor service. We thought maybe it was an off night for them after receiving one drink in an hour and waiting on our food for forever. It wasn't an event night or even busy. We were so frustrated having to try to dance on our heads to get a waitress' attention that we left to another place across the way. We went back on another night and still incredibly slow service and staff was so rude. The girls roll their eyes at you and act as if they're doing you the favor by them being there as bartenders. This place is not the cleanest and the food is not good. Never again.

Reservations.. Ha - they don't fulfill their promises. All of the reviews that at above 1 star is a joke. 15 bucks for a vodka redbull and they don't  even put redbull in it lol. Over priced, terrible service, don't recommend.. Stay home if you have the option or don't come here at all. I'm done ranting, just enter knowing you're getting terrible service and overpriced drinks

The service was horrible... the food was fair, but nothing I would go back and eat. The place (structure) is really nice, but the staff is awful.  Our waitress was really nice and all smiles but her service was still lame, we were not greeted when we arrived, we were not given cutlery, napkins, etc until after the food arrived (like 10 min), we could have left without paying since no one was paying attention to us, and the place was almost empty. The food is not the best, we enjoyed the Irish Fries or something, but we had to lick our fingers, and not because they were so delish, but because the napkins and forks were making their way trough the crowds and to our table. When we left, the hostesses were so into their conversation that they didn't see us leave... oh, well! That's what we get for wanting to try something new!

McFadden's Restaurant and Saloon? It should be ashamed to call itself a restaurant, and even they'd tell you it isn't a saloon. You'd expect a place like McFadden's to be Irish. There's nothing Irish about a very dark place playing overly loud ghetto music. We sat ourselves on the patio to get away from the loudness. We counted 4 security guards, 3 waitresses, and 2 bartenders. 9 Employees and it took 10 minutes to get someone to ask us if we wanted a drink. Then it took another 10 minutes to get the drink and I think there were only about 6 other customers. Most of the employees stand around and play with their phones.   There are much better places to go in Westgate. We went to McFadden's our first night in Glendale and it became the punchline for the rest of our trip.

All the other reviews hit all my complaints. Poor service, horrible stench and waaay over priced drinks.   The only think missing was noting that I have TWICE seen a freaking baby/toddler in McFaddens well after the appropriate hour. If the 'bouncer' is checking ID's at the door....there should not be small children in the freaking place.   I wish I could go back and say sorry to all my hotel guests that i've sent there in the past.   I couldn't help but laugh at loud at the many tables w/  "reserved" signs on them.  The bar was half empty LOL

Let's me just start with a WOW! From the start of walking in the host granted us with a warming welcome. The server we had never left us without a refill. Never had to flag our server down. This places food is sooo yummy for a club/sport bar. I ordered a Ruben. Pretty tasty man!! My man ordered the mac and cheese, It has a spice to it and  we both LOVED it.  so yummy. I will come here for ALL cardinals games coming up.

Not impressed.  I don't usually write bad reviews, but there was something really not good about this place.  We wanted to like it...but didn't.  The food was tasteless, with the exception of the fries that our daughter had, she said those were good.  Definitely not worth what we paid for it, and some items we got were at happy hour price!   The whole place had a very funky vibe to it.  Almost to the point of uncomfortable.  The bathrooms stunk to high heaven, it smelled like the dumpster outside...nasty.  Our server was good, very nice and attentive, if it wasn't for her, I probably would have given it one star.  We won't be back.
Music and bartender WAY too loud with terrible blaring sound system. No drink menu with specialty cocktails. Food sub par. One word for the bartender with the GoPro strapped to his chest: CREEPY.

I've given McFaddens two chances, both at incredibly slow times and both times, the service was terrible and slow.  The first time we were there, I'm pretty sure our server didn't realize she was supposed to be working and it was NOT busy in there.  I wish the food was good enough and it outweighed the bad service but it's just typical bar food.

First time and last time.  Went for dinner with friends with a $50 restaurant card. Had to have a $100 bill to use. Started with nacho appetizer,  was ok. The entrées were not worth the price! I had the gaelic chicken. Not sure what the sauce was but it was tasteless! The guys had hamburgers with maybe 7 fries. So we decided to try a dessert after a bland dinner. Nope worse than the entrée.  The chocolate mousse literally had NO flavor!! How does that happen.  Service was ok. Would never recommend and will not go back.
I wish I could give less than one star. This place is the shadiest bar I have ever been to. The staff/management is very unprofessional and will "remove" you from the bar for no reason whatsoever.

Stopped in here for lunch today with my wife and her parents.  It was 11:30 and there were no other customers in the restaurant.  It took a couple minutes for anyone to notice us at the door.  The person that seated us was also our server.  He was cool and the bright spot of this visit.  We found it weird as we were sitting there that an employee left, went to another establishment, and came back with food from there.  That just seemed rather odd.  The carpets were very dirty in this place.  The food itself was not bad.  Their fries actually are pretty tasty.  My mother in laws caesar wrap was really dry.  Very, very pricey for what it is though.  Maybe at night if you are looking for the bar scene it is not a bad place.  As a casual meal with your family it is overpriced, mostly tasty, and the server we had was very cool.  I cannot figure why an employee would leave a restaurant to go to another one to get food and openly walk back in with it?  That's like promoting weight watchers while eating nutrisystem food or drinking soda while trying to sell lemonade.  Not sure if we would come back to this place.

Bad business practices. Came here with a Groupon to try the place. We received the wrong food, bill was not corrected because we did not receive correct hamburger ( there are only 3 on the menu ), and then they refused the alcohol on the Groupon even though it Groupon includes. No happy hour specials... would not return.

Stopped back by there Wednesday and was told AGAIN by my server that they are going to change the menu in a few weeks. Seems like every 6 months or so they say they are changing the menu and then the fire the chef and start with a new one. This guy is the 4th one that I know of. Hope they keep him around because his jive white ass is pretty funny and the food seemed better than the last time I was there...

My fiance and I have visited McFadden's twice in the year.  Our first visit we meet with a few coworkers to grab a couple drinks. I asked for a Bloody Mary and received horrible concoction which would have been better off down the drain.  Our second visit was last night before a coyotes game. Every restaurant in West Gate had a 45 min to an hour wait but McFadden's was able to take us in as soon as we walked in the door. (That should have been warning  #1). The restaurant was uncomfortably warm, smelled like stale beer and was sticky and filthy. Our waitress was kind but when it came time to order beer, she had a list with 8+ beers that they have ran out off. (I hope they restock quickly because the Fiesta Bowl is right next door tomorrow). I feel that all the menu items are over priced for what you get.  After 40 minutes of waiting, the bacon in my BLT tasted a little strange and the fries were under cooked. The quesadilla was okay but very flimsy.  The restrooms were disgusting and I honestly did not like being bothered by the "restroom attendant".   Overall- service- pretty good food- poor drinks- poor cleanliness- very poor  *** We noticed that this establishment will be a Penn State hub for the Fiesta Bowl, if you are Penn State fan, save your money, time, and taste buds and go to another restaurant in West Gate.
Wait staff was great cook and bar tenders were poor we were watching a hockey game while dining and they just changed the channel and would bot put the game back on. Food was very sub par also

If zero stars was an option, this would be my grade for this smelly, dirty club.  Arrived post concert venue next door to find long entry line with not that full of a club.  Our drinks were all ice and watered down in small Dixie cups. The front tables were roped off for the fools buying bottle service... only one table filled with two lonely dudes....After only 2 rounds of drinks the bouncer/security came over to some other friends in our group and called out one in their group that was as he described as "having wobbled"... she was the most sober in the club, and after now reading other posts now I feel like there is a fishy pattern here. Fishing for bribes?  Not sure what the bouncers are trying to accomplish.

I came here a few weeks ago for a birthday, and that calamity was bad enough.  I held off on the bad review until I gave them another shot.  Well I did and they failed even harder.  1st trip -- we had reserved a table for a birthday, and as reservations were made it was made clear to us that if we weren't there by 9:00 they would give our table away.  So we arrive at 8:45 and they make it out to be a big inconvenience to them that we arrived......15 minutes early.  Nothing was setup, and they scrambled to get a "party" table put together (which I don't think ever reached the size we had reserved).  All decorations became "we could put ________ on the table but........we'd need for you all to get up".  So after all this I thought it could be a fluke, so we gave them another shot last night......  2nd trip -- Had a friend come in from England and he wanted to go to the bars at Westgate.  God forbid he wore shorts on his trip to.........Arizona, so we weren't allowed in.  It's Thursday night. And no matter how hard you try, you are not a Scottsdale bar.  Choke on your impending failure.

Yep No shock here why the owner of Calico also owns McFaddens and guess what? They both suck! The staff is run by bimbo teens who couldn't tell you there ass from there head ...when you say you can have your burger cooked to how you like (medium) and then when I bite into it it's cooked fully through...that's not cooked to order (waitress was also some teen bimbo) between McFaddens and Calico Jacks they are the eye sore of Westgate ...avoid going to either at all costs.....and when it's night time and it turns into a "bar" watch out for the asshole security ppl at the front door and throughout the place they take there jobs way too serious
Thee worst bar at west gate. Service all around is awful and the "FBI" agents aka bouncers are the absolute worst. So very rude. I will never go back due to the mistreatment.

This place is awful. I remember I went to there to have a great time, but a security guard came by that I've been taking pictures which I really didn't at all. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Stick to Calico Jack's, Saddle Ranch, and Hell's Half Acre.

This review is LONG OVERDUE. When you read reviews saying this is quite possibly the worst restaurant/bar, they are not exaggerating. I have been here MANY times.. Mainly because it's convenient for my friends who live on the west side, and also because it's easy to go to after the coyotes game.   Don't get me wrong, this place used to be mediocre a few years ago, and it wasn't dreadful. Now I am seriously SHOCKED when I hear it is still open.  Let me give you a little run down of the experience here...   They are DESPERATE to get people in. If you are on their "VIP" email list they will legit email you every weekend and say you have won, and you can get free drinks from 9-11.   And when you get there... They don't have the AC on and they will have all the doors open so it's 115 inside. You will be sweating and crying and wondering where your life went wrong that you had to come to mcfaddens.  The music is usually good.. That's the ONLY plus.. And I mean ONLY.   They give free shots to girls every Friday and Saturday and usually it's fireball. They will make them get on the bar and dance.. It's usually pretty entertaining to watch. The drinks are WEAK.   They have this Asian male bartender who will ALWAYS get on the bar and take his shirt off and do some sort of weird breakdancing. He thinks he is God's gift to earth. this is also very entertaining.   They like to throw hundreds of napkins in the air and scatter the entire dance floor. Not only is this extremely annoying, it's also disrespectful and wasteful. It's makes me cringe. And they get stuck to your shoe and you look like a teenager from a bad 90's movie who is coming out of the bathroom with toilet paper on her shoe.  If you have nothing to do on a Saturday night, go in and order a beer, stand in the corner and watch the shit show commence. You're welcome.

We thought we would get a beer and catch part of the hockey game from the patio bar.  First, they have bouncers and card you as you go in- classy. Second, the staff just stared at us as we tried to find our way to the patio. When we got there finally, it was a mess and there was only a handful of customers and tons of staff. So we just left and went to the faithful stand by at Westgate- Yardhouse.

Went here before Amy Schumer for dinner and drinks. Because the line/wait was the shortest. There's a reason it was the shortest wait in the area. Its awful!  The service was awful, the server delivering our sloppily made apps, tots a toddler wouldn't touch, she dumped half the plate on the table and then tossed out a half ass "sorry".  Before she left we asked if we could get some ice water and she instructed us to "ask your server". Ummmm, ok. Thanks. Onto the drinks. We ordered a beer tower. They brought it to our table...filled with hard cider. Not beer.  They fixed that somewhat quickly. Then our main courses. Looking around the table at everyone's plates you would have thought we were at cheap McFastFood establishment. It was a total fail, wilted lettuce (not supposed to be wilted) waterlogged tomatoes. Questionable "fish" and chips and a lovely turkey wrap that looked as though it came straight off a costco platter full of those little wraps you get for big parties when you dont want to do any prep work. Yep. Awesome. Never going back. Recommend you skip this place and wait in line for one of the better restaurants.

Yelp forced me to give a star before posting my review. However, ABSOLUTELY NO stars for this hot mess! I've seen bad meals, bad service & bad management before, but this one was epically bad! Should've known better when the apathetic waitress stated today was the first day of the new "brunch" menu. Red flag ignored - my bad. Ordered the corned beef with poached eggs over potatoes, green peppers & onions. No toast or coffee included for $10.99.  What I got was a lot of onion (cheap veggie cost) with very little pepper over a frozen hashbrown pattie (think McDonalds) with corned beef that had been over-boiled (God knows when) which left it tough, stringy & flavorless with 2 poached eggs....really more hard-boiled than poached.  I requested 2 new poached eggs which were perfectly cooked, but served floating in a bowl of water. I had a fork & knife, but no spoon so, I managed as best I could to get the eggs onto the aforementioned dish without including the pool of water. Unfortunately, I failed adding more soak to an already soggy situation. I picked at it until finally giving up and asked, via one of the young bussers, to see the manager. The poor young man came back to my table and said, "He asked me to ask you what you wanted."  Uhhhh.....just forget it.  I have more sense than to put a busser in the middle of a situation that should be handled by the manager. Hello? McFadden's corporate office??!!  BTW: $9 Bloody Mary served in a plastic cup with no celery, olives or even a cocktail napkin (pet peeve) etc. For $9 bucks you'd better add some veggies!  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!  TOO MANY OTHER OPTIONS!

Good times!! Entry was free and it was water party night. They had girls in bikinis with a variety of water party favors. They had some ladies dancing on the bar and passing out free shots. Good blend of music from old school to new school. I'll be back

When someone tells you you won a free Happy Hour (no cover for you and your party) and $2 drinks the saying "Too good to be true" should come to mind here at McFadden's. Only limited well drinks are $2 and they are so watered down you don't taste anything and house margaritas are not included.  I ordered 2 different drinks and they both came with cracked and chipped glasses that leaked all over me and the table. I then thought "ok, Irish pub" so I ordered a Jameson's and it was awful!  I asked what they gave me and the waitress couldn't tell me, I asked what Irish whiskey they had and she told me 1 type of Jamison's and that's it!!!!  Please save yourself the time and effort to come here, it's not worth the "free" drinks!  If I could give this place negative stars it would be the full 5 negative.

Didn't stay long so not much to say except it was the worst smell every when we walked through the doors. It was like a sewer.  We saw drunk people playing beer pong and we just had to leave.  If you are really drunk this might be the place for you.
Everyone was right, but for different reasons.  Most of our food was cold and our beer warm. Guess at half price, you get what you pay for.  Even bathrooms rivaled Circle K - gross.

We went there after purchasing something from restaurants.com. UGH!  We went around 6 on weeknight and it was DEAD.  We stood there for quite awhile before being seated.  The keep the doors open, so there were flies everywhere.  There were TONS of open seats, and they sat us next to this completely obnoxious set of 20 something girls.  The chairs were weird.  When you sit in them you sink down so low the table comes up to your chest, I felt like I was 5 years old.  The food was NOT good.  This place needs to close up so a better place can move in.  With competition like the Yard house and Margaritaville....it won't last.  We won't go back.
Tonight I heard they were holding a Seahawks Pepper alley, and I was told that they would not be holding a Cardinals pep rally the same. Why would I as in Arizona resident ever want to go here?

I've seen a lot of bad reviews, so I must have lucked out on my day. I went there with two friends for a late lunch on Thursday. The service and the quality of the food was outstanding. I had the Shepherds Pie and one of my friends had a Sausage and Cabbage dish that we both loved. I will defiantly be going back.

The worst bar I've ever been to. Food was awful.  Service was slow. Then the waitress added gratuity to our bill and didn't tell anyone in our party.  She open up her iPad to run our credit card, handed the iPad to me and said "if you would like to add a tip, you're welcome to." No mention that gratuity was already included.  I wasn't able to view my bill either to see that the gratuity had already been added because the iPad screen only showed the tip screen and the total.   Please don't patronize this place. First and LAST time I'll spend my money there.  The manager did offer a $30 gift card, which was nice, but that waitress pulled one of the shadiest moves I've seen in a while. I hope you enjoy the $33 in tips you stole from me, jerk.  Merry Christmas.

One of the worst bars I've ever been to. Been here several times on the weekend and hated it more and more every time. It's a frat party atmosphere with less class. Every Saturday same routine weird shirtless Asian guy spits fire during Pitbulls fire ball song while they pour fireball all over thirsty 22 year old who can't think of a better drink than a free one. A couple hours later the fights start breaking out and the bouncers start forcibly removing anyone with a buzz that doesn't have a pair of breast. I've actually watched a bouncer fight a guy because the bartender put a spot light on him for not tipping, all the while getting the entire place to boo the guy and call him a cheap a$$. The guy "for some odd reason" got upset by this. Overall this place is a trashy somewhat seedy place. Pretty sure the bathroom attendant was selling Coke on one of the busier nights I was there. I think Mcfaddens is single handidly responsible for west gates bad image.

Pros: My experience, Fun environment, great location, good food..  Cons: My experience, first off my friends and I all got card info stolen here so be careful take cash, male bartender was rude and wasn't constant on prices they switched up every time we ordered the same extract drinks. Overall it's ok but there's so many other bars around the area that have great customer service and won't have to worry about your  card info getting compromised. I won't ever ever go back to this mcfaddens.

Husband & I stopped here for lunch after meeting about season tickets for the AZ Coyotes. Hubs had the Reuben which only had meat on 1 side of the sandwich. I had a chicken Caesar wrap that was below average taste. I'm not sure if it was because of the off season of sports or what but we were not impressed & will probably not go back. Even the draft beer & water tasted like the tubes hadn't been cleaned in a while.

The worst place ever. We paid $200 per person for a buffet and Super Bowl party, there was no food on the buffet and we tried to order some and were told they were too busy. We did eat some food early in the day there and it was cold and dry, nasty food,We bought raffle tickets for a drawing that cost $100 and they never drew winners. We kept asking the employees when they would draw and no one had an answer. We requested a refund and they refused. Bad service, bad overpriced food and the management was no where to be found, they overbooked the party and ran out of food, we didn't get anything we paid for, very disappointing,,,,, I would never go back there, terrible place and filthy bathrooms too!

Came here for dinner and drinks with an out of town friend. Not a good first impression for Arizona. The food was subpar and drinks were average. I ordered the Molly Cristo and she got the chicken wrap. Our whiskey sours were 99% watered down whiskey and a splash of sour. Pricing was okay but our waitress was not attentive, served our food and walked away without asking if we needed anything- we waited 10 minutes for her to walk by so we could get condiments. Took another 20 for us to grab her to get our bill. Food = C+, Drinks = B-, and Service = D

I have been here 2 times.   The first time i went, my husband and I went it was for a date night. We waited for a table and our buzzards never went off and there was obviously 4 tables open. I finally asked and the woman said "oh, I'm sorry" and actually put us next to the bar. It took forever to get food... and when it came out it was cold. But our server she was awesome. The food was cold and it I just was not seeing what all the talk was about.  The 2nd time myself and some other military wives came last night. Although it took forever to get a drink which I was not understanding why because not a lot of people were ordering drinks. I often order the same drinks... and I ordered a "Pink Pu**y" which it did not taste like it at all. I felt there was more juice than anything.   It mostly felt like a boring bar... there was water on the floor when I was walking out ans nearly busted my bottom. (Can you guys mop?)

Went here with friends July 3rd and it was packed and every time I would ask one of the bartender to make a drink he was rude and complained while making out drink. He was a white dude with curly hair.
The cute waitresses are usually the only draw to this bar. The food is sub par bar fare. The drinks are always weak. If you are destined to dine at Westgate I recommend the sushi joint or Yard House.
shot shot shots for birthday girl. Fun bar for girls night out. They could use better drink specials.

Tonight was the most horrific night of my life. When I tell you I have never left an establishment so infuriated in my life I don't know what to say. I was kicked out for being nothing more than a black woman in a white establishment. I will NEVER darken this doorstep again. The security couldn't even explain why I was kicked out. They claimed I was drunk. As an educator I've never been drunk in public. I'm always aware of my demeanor. But the racists within this place decided I'd been here too long and needed to go. This review is the first of my complaints. I have never felt so segregated and disrespected in my entire life. Just know that I'm so not done with this organization. As a black person in Phoenix please understand that your money and presence is not welcome here. Find somewhere else to use your buying power.
This bar is always busy on the weekends and I have no idea why. There's a cover to get in, the staff is cocky, and the drink prices are insane I got charged $12 for a loaded beer. Never again!

No big deal, only reason why there are so much people eating here is because of the location. With all the bad ratings, if this place was somewhere else. They might not be able to survive? With that said, its not a bad place to go before your event starts. I had the chicken quesadilla. It was OK, nothing special. Chicken was grilled, with peppers and cheese. Wife had the hamburger, she said it was good. Service was actually pretty good, kept our drinks full, and came by to check on us a lot. Like I said, if you have an event to attend at the Stadium or the Arena. This is not that bad of a place, however other restaurants in the area are better.

text.text: You know how the guy on ESPN uses the catchphrase "Useful....useful shot"?  Well, this review is Useful....if you want a shot. Go here, it suits you well.  ~Fud/Drink~ I smiled when I saw Restaurant in the title for this place. The food is consistently sub-par, even the apps are lackluster. I got sick here prior to a Coyotes game, thank you McFaddens for making me howl PRIOR to the game itself. I thus, never have eaten here again, because why bother when you get sick from an appetizer. Not too appetizing. You go here to get wasted, but where is the fun in that? Speaking of drinking, the drinks are average as well. Its your average bar option, nothing with pizazz. I could recommend it if there was something of note, like Saddle Ranch's Beer Tower, but they aren't even that creative here. The beer's are expensive as well. Why am I paying so much for these suds and wretched food? It's just a lose-lose situation. Also, its a poor choice if you want something Irish, because its a saloon, right? Haha.... If you come here, later, during the game, you will be asking yourself  "Why did I come here.....?"  ~Atmosphere/Service Just when the food is bad here come the waitstaff, who are not quite bright in the head. You go in, you sit down, and they do not attend to you quickly. You would think after repeated attempts to waive your hand in the air (I rarely do this, its a necessary evil), that they would see you. They don't. They must have some kind of Ray Charles syndrome. Or Stevie Wonderitis. Can you name another blind person style syndrome? Message me with one and I can add it, because that would be what the waitstaff must have... Actually, the blind are upstanding citizens with amazing senses, they would probably do a better job, hence I feel bad bringing them up. Oh well, anyway....   ~Extras/Rating~ You might be surprised they get even two stars...and heck, they really do not deserve them. I give them one star for the location and another for still, after all the bad experiences, not being the worst bar I've attended to this point. Congrats to that! They are more worthy of 1 1/2 stars, but why not, I have pity on this spot...so two it is. Just stick with me on this one, and stay away guys! Leave this place for the drunks. There are so many better options in this center. I mean, seriously.

I was the D.D. and they kicked me out for "being too intoxicated"?!?!?!? THE F*CK, YOU SAY?!?! Do I look like Jesus? Do you think I turned water into wine???? A box of rocks has a higher IQ than the people working here.  I don't recommend coming here, but if it's filth, watered down drinks, thieving bouncers, and stolen credit card info is what you're into...then HEY! COME ON DOWN.  Not really. That was a joke. Please don't go there. You'll be battling with your credit card company forever cause your card was cloned behind the bar and then used for a shopping spree multiple places in the valley.

Went to McFaddens to watch football games. The bar was mostly empty but the service was still pretty bad. We had a hard time getting our waitress to reappear. Drinks were overpriced. I think the worst part was the men's bathroom. There were paper towels on the floor and rags in the sink. When I let the hostess know about it she asked where the attendant was. I did not see an attendant. 20 minutes later, same scenario. An hour later I saw an attendant. But the place was still trashed. Won't be going back.
One star is about right. Terrible food, terrible service. Mashed potatoes were rancid and inedible.

Skip this place. It's crowded, which is cool of that's what you're looking for on a Friday, but it's not worth their wannabe security bullshit. I JUST moved from California and this is my first time in the area. Since this is my first time in the area, apparently not knowing the names of the surrounding bars means you're "too drunk". Luckily I came with my bf who is a LEO who explained that I seriously did not know the area and legitimately had two fucking beers and we were permitted entrance. With that in mind, we went to a couple friendlier spots near by so, please, skip this place. They don't need your service and you don't need their attitude.

Stopped by for lunch with group of 12 while attending function at nearby hotel.  Only 1 other table occupied in entire place should have been sign.  Place smelled strongly of disinfectant.  Worst looking bacon (dried out and dark) on BLT, burger raw in spots, fries tasteless and cold.  Server charged us all wrong price on lunch specials.  To top it off took over 20 minutes for him and manager to get new checks and they were still wrong. Made us late for our conference back at the hotel.  Other than possibly a drink before or after a game or concert, absolutely no reason to come here.

This is a great bar atmosphere for before a game, but their food is so mediocre that I would never eat here again. The burgers and sliders were so bland. Fast food restaurants have so much better burgers then here. The prices for food were also outrageous for the quality you get. I would definitely only recommend this bar for drinks before a game, that's the only reason I am giving it 3 stars.

This is my first review on yelp because yeah am too lazy to type but this place needs a review coz it's the shittiest bar in the valley! In such a prime location it definitely needs to be shut down. This waitress forgot her name, oh how I wish I remembered the name, but she's not that important obviously, so I get there am the first person on that side of the counter so I sit, two other guys join me one on my right and one on my left. The guy on my left apparently is a frequenter there so he says hi to her n calls her name he gets served first. The other guy on the right gets a hi and how are u doing what would u like me to serve u, he gets his ice tea, all this time am just looking at her waiting on her to even look at me and acknowledge my presence but apparently that was too much to ask. She finally did and served my beer. It was happy hour lets just said I had one beer and tipped $0 because that's exactly what she deserves. I hate to do that but they gotta close the place up no need to go in somewhere n leave more pissed!

Awful! Went to enjoy St. Patrick's day festivities with some friends, and was harassed by two women at the bar ordering drinks. They called me 2 racial slurs. I kindly asked the ladies if they would like to order before me (as they were clearly angry with my presence of being another ethnicity), and they continued calling me the slur and laughing. My friends came over, I told one what just occurred and she simply asked the women if they called me the said racial slur. One of the girls signals a McFaddens security guard (her friend) who asks to have my friend removed from the bar. I go outside to confront the McFaddens security guard, and proceed to ask him why the ladies calling me racial slurs were not removed, however myself and my friends were. He proceeded to confirm those ladies would also be removed. This never occurred. I have the entire conversation on video, as well as lack of promise that culprits were removed from the establishment. The staff at McFaddens is not a place you would want to give your money to if you're a minority, as they not only promote, but encourage racism.

McFadden's is not really a pub, at least not in the traditional sense.  Really it's just a party place for drunk students, which is fine if that's what you're looking for.  Food and service is average at best, but if you're looking for a party atmosphere, especially at night, then this place is for you.
Worst Irish pub I have ever been too. They should label themselves as a regular club because they have no Irish authenticity and have no reason to call themselves an Irish pub. I will never return

When I first came to Phoenix a year ago I really enjoyed going out on the weekends to Westgate and usually ended up hanging out here at some point during the night. At that point it wasn't too bad, just mainly overcrowded, but it seems like every time I go here lately the place gets worse and worse. The employee's seem to always have a bad attitude and the bouncers are constantly looking for a reason to kick the guys out, as if the girls you're with are gonna stay after they eject you.

My friend and I were going to a concert at jobing.com arena and my friend decided we should have dinner at McFadden's before the show.  Since she was buying I said ok.  Should have looked at the Yelp reviews first.  Also should have noticed that every other restaurant near the arena had a long wait and McFadden's... no wait at all.  This should have been a clear sign to stay away from this place but we went in anyway.  As we walked in the hostesses at the front desk were ready to seat us right away.  The male manager came toward the front desk and said "Ladies, how are you doing?"  Both of us said "Great, thanks" only to find he was looking at the girls who had walked in behind us wearing skimpy dresses.  He completely ignored us despite the fact that we were right in front of him and talked directly to him.  So rude.  Our waitress came to take our order wearing Victoria's Secret yoga pants.  Really?  I ordered water to drink because I'm not a beer fan.  The water tasted like sewer water.  It was revolting.  It was 110 degrees and muggy outside so for me to choose dehydration over that water, it was truly foul.  Both my friend and I decided to order burgers (the menu has a VERY limited selection).  She ordered hers medium rare and the waitress told her they couldn't cook it less than medium.  She said ok, whatever.  She also asked for a side of ranch and a side of mayo with the burger.  When I went to order my burger I asked for it well done.  The waitress said "sorry, we can't cook it any way other than medium."  What??  I have never been to a restaurant that was unable to cook food the way a customer wants it.  What's the point of being in business if you can't cook meat the way a customer wants it cooked??  She said on event days it's too busy for them to be able to cook anything in any different way.  There were 4 tables in the entire restaurant with patrons sitting at them.  Even the tables in the bar were empty.  So having 4 tables means they're too busy to make food the way a customer wants it.  That is flat out ridiculous.  I will not eat meat that is undercooked so I decided to order the philly cheesesteak sandwich instead after being assured the meat in that sandwich is actually cooked.  Our food arrived... my friend's food arrived with no side of ranch and no side of mayo.  The waitress brought them out later.  My cheesesteak was soggy because they use a runny cheese sauce.  My friend was also disappointed that they don't toast the buns on their burgers either.  The only redeeming thing in our meal were the fries - they were very good.  But you can get good fries anywhere.  I would never go back to McFadden's.  I'd rather wait an hour for one of the other restaurants in the area.

Take me off your stupid text message list. Your place is garbage, "bartenders" are terrible, I haven't been here for over 2 years ago and was conned into giving my # for upcoming specials, and I still get texts. I'm never coming back to your shit hole so stop texting me.
Something wrong with Irish Pub and Bud Light signs all over.  Walked in and found relatively empty at 830pm and all TV's on UFC fighting.  Turned around and left

This Irish bar has no horseradish to go with their corned beef.  Blasphemous. Also Guinness was served in a plastic cup in the dining room. So offensive to anyone with Irish blood coursing through their veins.  Not magically delicious.

Need more bartenders! Paid 20$ for a cover charge but got horrible service on st Patrick's day. Yes I am aware of the day but I expected better service. I have gone here pervious days and service always sucks
Just awful! Especially the bar manager and male Italian bartender.  Beware of what try put in your drinks.

This place is always a great time on a Friday or Saturday night! People everywhere having one hell of a time and DJ always spinning the hip tunes! It's got a great feel once the music gets turned up and the tables clear out for sure! I would say this place is in my opinion the most entertaining place inside Westgate on a Friday or Saturday night.   The only things I dislike about their business operation is the fact that they charge a $5 cover charge to get into the place. I wish I can just tell the door I plan on spending over $100 in booze once I get in and then get a no cover charge. Seriously it's like a slap in the face charging a cover! It's a good way to turn away people. I see it all the time.   Well any-who... Once you get into the joint it's pretty cool. They have a couple beer tub girls serving bottled beers and a huge inside and outside bar. Once this place gets cracking the dance floor can get pretty energetic and intoxicated ladies usually somehow end up on the bar shaking it. Pretty good eye candy I might add! Haha  Staff behind bar seem pretty organized and adequately paced getting and fulfilling drink orders. They have a good amount of security on staff, so if you plan on getting rowdy, you might want to plan on answering to Glendale PD, that is after you're carried out of the place.   If I were to give this business some great advice and a little gem of profitability over the other establishments... Get ride of the cover charge and slightly increase the price on the inventory! ;)  Just a thought... But who am I right?! Haha

WORST place to go at Westgate! They charge a cover AND their drinks are overpriced. We went there after the cardinals game and the drink menu gave us the price of drinks but they never told us that drinks DOUBLED on game day. For a small crown & Coke that was originally priced at $10 each (still overpriced) it was $20 on game day. For a sports bar, their food is awful and their drinks are watered down. Do not go here. Staff is unprofessional and  waitresses are slow. If you want a sports bar experience, run far away from here. Disappointed.

My review is based strictly on this place as a bar, as I've never eaten here.  It's usually crowded on the weekends and for some odd reason they (staff/bar dancers) like to throw tons of napkins in the air, which is probably cool to the many intoxicated dancers on the floor.The problem is the napkins get all over the floor and mixed in with the spilled drinks, so now everyone is stepping on the napkins and they're getting stuck to everyone's shoes. Music is okay, the layout is pretty cramped... I don't ever go here by choice, only when a group of people I'm with want to.

Would not go back. With an hour wait at Yard House we decided to give McFadden's a try. Due to an event going on at the arena, there were no specials, and a very limited menu. Decided on the sliders, which came out burned to a crisp around the edges. Friend had the BLT and said it was not worth the price. Fries were seasoned well, but if the fries are the only good thing there, I'm not coming back. A busboy came by at least 10 times asking our friends plate. There was still food left, and they kept telling him no. He seemed to be getting impatient with them. When they did finish and he took the plate, I was the only one who heard him say, finally! Um, rude? Bathroom was in a horrible state. I get it, it was busy. But someone should be checking on them every half hour, at least.

Food was good not great. Came in on a Monday and I was 1 of 5 people. So service was good. Cobb salad was fair. Dressing was watered down but was ok. Probably wouldn't come back for food. But maybe for a drink.

This is your typical wanna be Phoenix version of the Irish Bar.  The food was ok.  Typical sports bar fare.  I will say the service was pretty good except for the ditzy hostesses.  Do they really need three 16 year olds manning the front of the restaunt texting and pretending to be listening?    The happy hour on Friday is great, lasting till 9:00 pm which is unheard of.  But dont stick around much longer after that unless you are  into the club scene. Because out come the lazer beams and smoke machines.... Hahaha no not really but they bust out the dance floor and make you move your seat so Glendales finest underage drinkers can shake their groove things.  It is funny how this bar resembles the cheesy old town bars that westsiders always seem to bag on.
Personally had great service here! I loved the shots provided and the music was on point. I'm not sure about when it's busy because I only went on a Thursday but still enjoyed it very much!

Why are you charging a $10 cover when the bar is three quarters empty for St. Patrick's Day why don't you give me a drink for over 30 minutes why did my food take over one hour this is the worst Mcfaddens in the history of the Irish bar the unluckiest I was by Bever been to

Do not eat the shrimp mac and cheese. Went here before the coyotes game. By the time it was over I was sick as a dog. Spent 5 days married to the toilet if you know what I mean. My boyfriend ate a few bites and had a stomach ache that night.

We were on vacation and decided to go to Mcfatten us for dinner. We were told they had really good fish and chips. We walked in there were five girls standing around talking, and after they finish their conversation they decided to seat us. A few minutes later they sat a party of six next to us. We were still waiting for the waitress to come and take our drink order. When the waitress finally came she went to the other table first and took there order. As she started to walk away we called and said, excuse me can we get something to drink we've been sitting here. The waitress told us they didn't have any Chardonnay wine so we ordered something else. When she brought the glasses over one of them had lipstick all over the rim, and one of the glasses was chipped. Since the waitress never came back to check on us, I brought the glass to the bar and asked the bartender if they had Chardonnay and he said yes. When the waitress brought the food over to the table she never said anything to us. We had to ask for condiments. We were on our way to a baseball game and needed to leave so we took The check up to the five girls that were still standing around and they said we had to wait for our waitress to take the bill, which took about 10 minutes. Needless to say this was the first time we did not tip our waitress. We would understand if she was really busy, which she wasn't. On a positive note, the bartender was great, & and the food was OK. Won't be returning there...
This place is just like the 1.5 stars it has. If your anidiot like me you deserve to find out for yourself. If your smart you'll read these reviews and act accordingly.

4/8/2017 We went there with a group of eight of us all of our orders were messed up besides the slow service and very filthy bathrooms. I would not recommend this place the food was awful and the service was awful awful!! all eight of us were very disappointed!!

Am I getting too old for this?  Me thinks not!  Granted I'm not the youngest cat in the crowd, but I think I deserve some love don't I?  Well I guess not at McFadden's. I might not be that young lad that buys drinks for everyone and continue to pound down shots of liquor in the attempt to get myself drunk anymore.  However, I'm the guy that can actually afford it without burning a hole in my wallet - wink!  Maybe you should be looking my way next time instead of continue to serve the drunk dude down the bar who probably shouldn't be drinking anymore unless tent city is the next destination for him.    Loud obnoxious drunks and college frat party like atmosphere only goes so far.  Let's just keep it where it belongs because I really don't know if it should be public thing unless it's a place called Vegas.  Westgate is no Vegas!    I can party with the best, but even I felt uncomfortable here.  Let's just say if a fight broke out I wouldn't be surprised.  Patio is nice, but without a smoke vent is sucks -- yes I know the "patio" needs a smoke vent!  Unfortunately a bad experience this time; we'll see if I ever return to do a follow-up. - Enjoy!
This one is pretty simple. Only good to grab a drink, maaaaaaaaybe two, before a game and move on

The worst service you can ask for. The service is slow, the servers are rude, and the food looks/tastes like it's been blasted dry in the microwave. This place cuts all sorts of corners. I see workers who don't wash their hands and I've seen dirty rags used on the floor then touch the tables and plates without being cleaned. I also witnessed roaches crawling in and out of doors. I would never order anything from this "restaurant/bar". They have substandard practices. I wouldn't be surprised if I ended up with profuse diarrhea or projectile vomiting in a few hours. DO NOT COME HERE. Go across the plaza to better quality establishments.

Crowded, messy, inattentive staff. Was asked to leave once when I tripped over a spilled glass. After explaining the situation they still asked me and my party to leave. Drinks not worth the money, warm beer, very poorly made mixed drinks. Beer tub girls are sometimes rude, but I highly recommend going to them as you'll spend 15+minutes at the bar unless you are a scantily clad woman.

We started out our night here at about 9pm.  We got carded on the way in and my brother and husband were immediately told that at 10pm sharp - they had to take their hats off because the pub turns into a night club.
