I guess that should have been the warning to just turn around and walk out right there.  But we were meeting some people and we thought we'd try it out.  So we find a table and order a beer.  The waitress says, "oh can I see your ID's?"  I explain that we got carded at the door.  She claims she still needs to see them.  Whatever.  So since we are from out of state, she has to get a manager to look at them.    For the love of god, I just want a BEER!  5 minutes later the manager comes by and "approves" our ID's.  Thanks dude, we make the over 21 cut by like 10 years.  Seriously.  The other thing that bothers me about this place is that they have a "DJ" guy who stands there and plays shitty music, yet likes to hear himself talk more than anything.  Between EVERY song, he has something to say.  This is not necessary, dude.  People don't care what you have to say.  People are here to talk to their friends not listen to you and your shitty music.  Annoying.  At 9:30pm they had a promo where everyone gets a little shot of Guinness to toast to.  But WAIT!  Not without showing your ID for the THIRD freakin time.  Am I in prison here?  10pm comes and the military-like douche bouncers come out.  Yelling at my brother and husband to take their hands off even though we explained that we are leaving.  Other people were wearing flip flops and shorts and other casual attire.  WTH is wrong with a hat?  We didn't want to bring down the atmosphere of their club by wearing a hat, so we left.    Hopefully never to return.

Horrible food and service both!! Went for dinner on a Saturday night around 7, place 3/4th empty, should have beeen a red flag. Waitress does not know what a 7 and 7 is- conversation goes:  "It's Seagram's 7 and 7-up". "What is Seargams 7? I really don't know anything about the drinks". Takes over 15 minutes to get the drinks. Had checked out the menu online and hubby was ready for corned beef n cabbage. Ooops, sorry, that's not actually ON the menu. After some grumbling, picks the Philly Cheesesteak...Guess what, that's ON the menu but they no longer serve it. "We're redoing our menu", sorry. All 5 of us get burgers. After another ridiculous wait period, which we spent watching the manager oogle and fondle all the female waitstaff, the burgers arrive. Two ordered medium rare, three ordered medium.... All burgers are well-done rubber hockey pucks with fake grill marks. Obviously out of a box of frozen burgers. Of the three that had bacon, the bacon on all 3 was stone cold. Two had buns that were cool, one had a bun that actually had a frozen spot in the top if it! The frozen one with ice cold bacon was returned, the rest of us were too hungry so ate. Catsup and mustard on tables, but 8 of the catsup bottles in the immediate area are completely empty! We raid 9 other tables to find one that's half full and present the waitress with the empties as a gift..... And still waiting for that replacment burger. The redone burger still not there by the time the rest of us finished, had to go hunt down the manager because waitress had vanished. Manager solution? "We can put it in a to-go box for you". Bartender had thedecency to apologzie and offer a free drink, but too little too late.Absolutely will not give this place a second chance, recommend you steer clear too! Margaritavlle or the Yardhouse would have been a much better bet. :(
Great place, Great location, WORST SERVICE! No one at the door. We waited 20 min to order a beer!

Just tried this place a couple days ago. The food came out freakishly fast (like, TOO fast!). We got the nachos, which were not very good at all...I've had better nachos at movie theaters and gas stations (should've known better than to order something with "cheese whiz" in the menu description). I'll give it 3 stars though because the server was really nice and was able to keep up with refills (which says a LOT since my boyfriend can chug Dr. Pepper like no other), and the goat cheese salad was actually very good. Bf had the shepherd's pie--wasn't bad but we've had better (and for $15 I thought the portion should've been bigger--it's half potatoes, and potatoes are cheap!) The waitress actually came over looking concerned after the first couple bites because "it's one of the things on the menu that's been really inconsistent." Good to know, I guess...

Leaves a lot to be desired. We went on a night when they had "parties" because my boyfriends brother won a "party"  The good thing was the 2 dollar drinks.  The bad thing was pretty much everything else.  It turned very skanky at 11:00..  Not my thing..  And the music was too loud.   That's not a pub in my opinion.. Since when do pubs need security and people dance on the bar half naked?  Don't get me wrong, there is a place for that, but I just wish there was somewhere decent at westgate to hang out.. Any suggestions?

Not a fan of this place. Drinks are over priced, crappy music, and slow bartenders make it nearly unbearable. However, the $2 happy hours they pass out like candy make it a good pregame spot. Since it's one of the few dance places it attracts all the scantily clad clubrats. A lot of my friends like it but it's not my thing. It gives pub a bad name.

We should've known to take our business elsewhere by the previous Yelp reviews and the fact that McFadden's was not so crowded.  But I think my group of five was giddy over getting last minute amazing seats to the Bon Jovi concert, that we just wanted to get a quick bite and a beer and head into the show.  The service was ok until the food arrived and it took a good five minutes to get napkins, forks, and water... The food was decent but nothing special at all.  I had the salmon entree (served with mashed potatoes and spinach) and the others went with chicken wings and chicken fingers (both served with french fries).  Needless to say, our time at McFadden's was the lowlight of the evening.  (And yes, I just made up the word lowlight!) The concert was incredible!  I will not be returning to McFadden's since there are plenty of other options to grab a bite before heading in to Jobing.com Arena.
The food was ok and the music very load. Could hardly have a conversation without screaming.

My husband was charged $200 for three drinks(2 beers & 1 cocktail). He didn't notice until it hit his account. This place steals money. He called to retrieve his money multiple times and the manager gave him the run around. They are thieves!!!!!!

The worst place to try to have fun.  I realized my zipper was down and zipped up my pants and was kicked out for it. Every time I come to Phoenix and we go to this place I regret it.   The food is horrible the bouncers are fat meat heads.  This place sux.
Had a great time for Fight Night. Got the boneless buffalo wings, they were really good!!

We got there around noon on a Tuesday.  It was dead, only 1 guy at the bar.  We waited for about 3 mins before someone noticed we were waiting for a table.  I should have known better to dine without checking Yelp first.    We got seated and the hostess notified us that she is also our server.  She took our drink orders.  And she was back right away with our drinks.  She took our food order.  We both ordered a soup and an appetizer for lunch.  We waited 15 mins and our soups came out  within 5 mins our food came out too.  IRISH POTATO SOUP - it came out warm, there was only a few chunks of potatoes, and tasted ok.  CHICKEN FINGERS - the chicken was not crispy but hard.  The fries were  good!  Service was actually good.  The food is not so good.

*Zero Stars* Rude staff, from doorman to Bartendar. Horrible DJ plays the same playlist week after week from 10 years ago. Not a place to dance to hip music and have fun. One of the employees are sure to spoil your night if the music hasn't already. We've been here many times and leave disappointed every visit. We will not return after this last one. Management must breed a culture of bad customer service and poor hospitality.

While I hesitate adding yet another review to this 1.5 star restaurant, I can't ignore the bad experience that I had while I was there. Firstly, I want to make it clear that our waitress was very nice and accommodating, so the service gets 5 stars. However. Upon arriving, I ordered a Long Island and my man ordered a dirty martini. I'm not that picky when it comes to drinks, but the Long Island came VERY watered down. It tasted like water and Splenda. I asked the waitress to switch it out for a glass of wine which they didn't have, so I settled for a rum and coke which was also watered down. At this point I gave up.  My boyfriends dirty martini came without olives. He went to the bar to ask for olives and the male and female bartender ignored him for at least two minutes because they were too busy chatting with each other. He moved to another side of the bar and another server or bartender helped him out and added olives to his beverage.  The food we ordered was sub par. His fish and chips were below average, and my nachos were just soggy beyond the first layer of a few chips, and the chicken was bland.  Overall, I just can't recommend this restaurant knowing that the food and drinks were almost ok awful level. Maybe if we hear that they've made major changes to their kitchen and bar we'll head back and give them another chance.

I was reminded last night of the reason why I strongly dislike westgate late night.  The bartenders pass you by as you are calling their name to get you a glass of water or even an alcoholic beverage and to make matters completely worse had pregnant looking girls with love handles for days shaking their lack of ass on the bar. Ewww. I know it isn't vegas but cmon managers hire somebody who can at least dance and has somewhat of some musical rhythm. I had this urge to get up there and push them off the bar and steal the outfit but why do it if I'm not the one being paid.   As I headed back to our table trying not to step on the endless amounts of dirty napkins that wanted to stick to my pumps last night and took a seat. This annoying females were screaming for no reason. I always run into the worst crowd at westgate for some reason, first some girl wants me to punch her in the throat for stealing my bf''s water and flirting with him and now this girl screaming. Sweet. The bathrooms were a complete disaster and I can tell you right now I highly doubt they have good food with how the ratings are looking already. Good thing my parents always eat at yard house when they drive down so that's hit or miss but probably a million times better than this joint.

The bar has a great location right outside the hockey/football arenas so it makes it really convenient if you are attending one of these venues. The issue I had was with the bartenders...They were way too caught up in their lives and social circles to bother with anything else. It had that feeling to where you are there for them instead of them being there for you. So expect to wait on them and let them finish their conversations, flirt and so on... Too many other good bars for me to return.
Very good burgers and fries, fish and chips were awesome. Our first time here, will definitely come back.

Most unpleasant restaurant experience. Well, the food anyway. Top item on the menu is Philly cheesesteak. When it was delivered, it was chicken. Apparently they didn't even inform the waitress that the menu item will no longer be served. Instead of asking if we wanted to order something else, the kitchen brought us a different dish. On top of it all, it did not taste good. The chicken had no flavor, the onions were microscopic and the peppers were also non-existent, like the cheesesteak itself. It happened to the table next to us as well. Poor waitress had no idea because she didn't deliver the food. Not worth my money.

By far the worst service and disrespect I have ever received as an out of towner at a restaurant. The general manager showed little respect for its patrons which is ashame because the waitresses were so nice. I would highly recommend the other bars and restaurants in this little square. This place is ran by a young inconsiderate moron with no concept of the customer experience.  Don't go!

This place was awful!!!! They we're playing the worst mash up of Christmas music and it was excessively loud. The tots were good but that was all. The roast beef looked and tasted like dog food. The hamburger bun was soggy like it sat in water. STAY AWAY!!

I went to McFadden's because I was staying at the Hotel across the street, and me and my girlfriend wanted to go somewhere convenient.  When we arrived, even though the Blackhawks were playing the Coyotes(in Chicago) in the playoffs, there were about 13 people (tops) in the place...which seemed strange to me. I then noticed that there were only 2 servers and a bartender working. Shouldn't have been too bad given the few people in there...but it was. It took 10 mins for the server to come to our table, another 15 for her to take our drink order and give us a menu then 20 mins to take our order.  Once the food came it was decent, but nothing special. Your usual Chilis', applebee's or any other chain restaurant fare. Again, nothing special.  The only reason I see that people would go here is because it's close to both stadiums and in the westgate plaza. If you are going there to only drink, fine, but don't expect the food to be great, or to get any service  FYI they don't even try to have an Irish theme at this restaurant.

The place smells like stale beer!  Food sucked couldn't do a side salad it looked like weeds! The place needs to be recused badly! Plumbing in women's room was on the floor. I would not allow my dog to eat there!

Wow...it looks like this place does not have many stars from other people...I didn't even look at reviews before writing mine. Tomorrow I'm going to try and track down the corporate office. Even one star is too much!  Patron's beware! McFadden's in Glendale, Arizona has hands-down one of the worst customer service policies ever! It is like this bar runs on a crew with their heads up each other's asses! Basically, this place SUCKS!!!   My experience was so terrible the only way to keep it together, without writing a book, was bullet points: * Attempted to organize an event for 20-15 employees. Had an office member contact the restaurant the week before to set it up. Relations person was more concerned with taking the credit card info to charge us if we did not show, or had less people, than sending the agreement. We never got anything in writing with these policies on it! Surprise, surprise...the only thing in the file was the credit card without a booked reservation. * Tried to call the location the day of the event to confirm. Was told by the hostess that I was not allowed to speak to a manager about this issue and she would not find someone for me to check the reservation. Called back with a different name and held for 14 minutes to speak to a manager that just said "Sarah" was off and would be coming in...Um, how is her staffing my issue? I had to badger her to even look into the issue. * Finally worked out the details and had tables reserved, the day of the event while my party was on the freeway going to the location. The first guests arrived after making our complaints to the manager and one of the bartenders made the remark "Those are some big shoes to fill" to our assigned server in front of guests. What, because we had to call to make sure we had a place to go? * The place smelled like vomit!! (Also noted in another customer's review) * Terrible, terrible, terrible service! Our server would only take one drink order at a time and often left the table without asking the customers with empty classes if they wanted another beverage. Hello...dumb ass...empty glasses means more opportunity to make more money?! Maybe the mandatory 18% tip for the party size blew our chances at having any sort of service.  * Drinks and food were sent to our table that we did not order. Food runners gave us attitude and stormed off when we told them the food did not belong to us. * Bill arrived with over $100 in extra charges for drinks we did not order were on it. We asked the server about it and her response was "Well, I am NOT taking them off" and walked off.  * Had to ask for another manager to come over because of the inflated bill. Took 20 minutes for him to get to us and the restaurant was not even busy. Manager was extremely patronizing and was not going to help us at first. After having to re-hash the details he took some of the drinks off, but not all of them. He claimed that the service "might" not have been that great because it was St. Patrick's Day that week. Didn't they have like 364 days to get ready for this?  * Waited another 30 minutes to get our change back. After coming back to the table the server put the bill and change in my face, glared at me and walked away. No "thank you" or anything for the 18% tip she was guaranteed because the size of the party. In all honesty, I would have totally stiffed her if it were a smaller party.  I was embarrassed that my group had to experience this. The only reason we decided to go there was one of my guests had won a happy-hour event there. My gut feeling when I could not confirm the reservation was to just go somewhere else, but was afraid that the only thing they would do correctly was charge the credit card for a no show. Knowing this I would have taken the group to Applebee's where we would have expected this. Our state relies on tourism and looking at the issue from a higher level the industry decline in does not rest only on the economy, but at these eateries internally. I am starting to point blame at the terrible customer in the service industry, weak and inexperienced restaurant/bar management, and shoddy company policies for their decline. If the industry truly cared about customers it would not be in this predicament.  Did anyone notice that their staff member was the only one to give this place like 5 stars? Maybe she should be a customer in it instead of part of the "family".
music sucks, the dj always play Wobble by V.I.C and is a one tick pony 2nd time I came I swear he played the same songs.. one word. GHETTO(people,music, etc.........).

Noisy. Crowded. Mediocre food.  I also call their cleanliness into question. Upon attempting to use a mustard bottle at our patio table, a piece of dirt/napkin/dried-out-mustard had jammed the tip of the squeeze bottle. What I thought was just thick mustard exploded all over myself and my wife when whatever was clogging the end was forcibly ejected from squeezing it.  +1 star because the waiter was kind enough to bring towels wet with soda-water for us to clean ourselves up.

My husband and I come here when we occasionally attend a Cardinals game and stay at the hotel next door. We've come in 4 or 5 times now over the last couple years. I'm here to confirm things and give my opinion. Warning, I may offend some people but this is just my observation.  1. Yes, the bathroom is disgusting. The doors are nasty. It doesn't help that its stainless steel and any smudge shows up. And yes it looks like they have not been cleaned in any way for months. Theres never any soap. The toilet seat covers are always empty, and a few of them are hanging off the wall by only one screw. The only good part about the bathrooms is its open, and at times there is a friendly attendant handing you paper towels. But did anyone stop to think that most of the customers using this said bathroom were completely trashed, and the employees are tired of cleaning up after them for the day? Not condoning the employees behavior at all, but you also have no idea what went on in that bathroom before you walked in there. Also.. haven't we all been to a dive that is worse then this?  2. I can only comment on the bartender service as we have never sat at a table and needed a server. I do vividly remember the first time we were there, and yes the service at first was a little rough. But my husband and I are friendly and started talking to the bartender. We were treating him like a human being doing us a service. We were joking, laughing, and having a good time. Sure, he was getting paid to make our visit enjoyable, but it worked. Then our service was wonderful. Our drinks were full and we were happy. Then, every time after that that we visited we got the same service. One specific bartender actually remembers us every time, and remembers what we drink and before we even get a chance to say "hi! haven't seen you in a few months" there is two beers sitting in front of us. If thats not service, I don't know what is.  We have been there during busy times as well. People watching is a habit of mine. Yes, I see you.. yes you. The jerk that demands service but then doesn't tip. The "lady" that wants the fruitiest drink ever, and because there isn't 5 shots of alcohol in this said drink they consider it watered down. The college kid that orders 5 different drinks for his drunk friends and then tips $1. That bartender you just pissed off remembers you. He or she knows that no matter what he or she does for you, you will only demand more, and tip less. There was a tall guy quite literally hanging over the bar, yelling at the bartender who was busy making other drinks on our last visit. When the bartender continued to ignore him, the guy was getting pissed. Meanwhile, our beers were empty and this said bartender grabbed us two beers before finally helping this person. Do NOT treat your bartender like less than human and then get mad that you get horrible service. Try treating your bartender or server like you were in their position, and maybe, just maybe they will treat you how you expect to be treated.   Now, there is an exception to that because this place has a long of young employees. Some I could swear are not old enough to even work. And unfortunately a lot of people don't really like their job and could care less that they just pissed you off. They just want the paycheck. So then you have a mixture of customers who have extremely high expectations, and employees that hate their job. Not a good mix. But considering this place has MANY reviews that all say the service sucks and it has 1.5 stars out of 5... maybe you shouldn't go in and then judge the place for its faults that you were completely aware that it had.   Now to the food. Well, I'm no chef, so to me the food was ok. I wouldn't recommend anything. And yes it is over priced. But its food, and we were hungry. After a few beers, we just wanted to eat something. The wings are dry, the mozzarella cheese fritters are greasy, the burger isn't seasoned. This isn't a five star food spot. Deal with it.   One last thing and then I will jump off my soap box. The only real issue we had was on our last visit. At a certain time the bouncers take the bar stools out from underneath you to make room for the crowd. For us to have been there for hours before this and then the bouncer very coldly yells at us "I'm taking the stools now". I turn around and ask "seriously?". And his reply was "seriously". I stand up and he takes the chair with nothing else said. Not a "thank you" or a "sorry". Just need to learn some manners, thats all.   Ok I'm done. I know its a dive, and everybody hates it, but we are still going to go there.

Our party of 4 stopped here on a Sunday prior to a kid's hockey game at Gila River Arena. I had been here once before prior to a Cardinals game and it was OK so we came back.  Restaurant was reasonably busy due to people watching the out of town Cardinals game but we were able to be seated on the patio immediately.   Our server took everyone's order (light lunch items) without writing anything down.  I said, "I wonder how she does that?"  Found out she doesn't. One order incorrect, sliders with cheese. Second try, still not hot and cheese slices just thrown on, not melted as you would expect. Server really unaware of the menu items. Slow service, lukewarm food for all items.  Unaware hostess.  No real reason to return so we won't. I don't think the staff here really cares about doing a good job.  Stay away.

What a major disappointment and I will explain why in full detail. Trust me this place deserves not a single star.  Last night my wife and I went to McFadden's and when we walked in I was happy to see UFC on and everyone was watching the fights. This was the only moment in my experience with this place that was a good moment.  This lasted maybe a half of an hour when we heard an announcement that anyone under the age of 21 must leave. Well, this obviously alienated many people who came to enjoy themselves with their family so you basically will lose potential dollars by kicking them out or asking them to leave. To make matters worse, managers / security or bouncers were asking people to give them their seat and table so they can clear the front of the building and make a dance floor. Again, people were not happy to have to get up and leave which includes the bar stools at the bar. I spoke to 4 individuals around me about what was going on and when they told me why they were doing it they showed their displeasure as well. Many people got upset at what was going on and simply left. I can't blame them.  Now the music started thumping and bumping loudly (In a Sports Bar) and some chick wearing practically nothing jumped up on the bar and started twerking. Really, twerking in a Sports Bar? It was such a classless act especially when I came to McFadden's to watch sports with my wife and have a table to sit at.   When my wife went to the restroom, she said there were 3 chicks grinding on each other in the restroom and one of them was a chick that gave towels and gum as you exited the restroom. Just a classless act and what a horrible place this establishment is.  If I wanted to go to a dance club I would have gone to a dance club. If I wanted to see strippers or to be modest, a chick half naked dancing on top of a bar I would have gone to a strip club or Coyote Ugly.  I am never going back to this classless place. The way in which management was telling people to get out of their seats was unprofessional and rude to say the least. Please do yourself a favor and do not go to this place. Go to the Yard House and enjoy great beer and an a great atmosphere and save yourself the headache.  I am glad I left, and will never return!  Dave
We ate here with my family before the monster truck show.  I had the nachos which were good.  My family had the burgers and the kids had chicken tenders.  We had a good dinner. Super fun time

If I could give 0 stars I would. I have never given a review this bad!! The food is HORRIBLE. How do you screw up a BLT. This place did! A chicken ceasar wrap with no ceasar? No dressing at all!! I was embarrassed for the pregnant waitress. It was so bad our toddler who loves to eat, didnt eat the chicken strips. Hardly any meat and they were cook to charcoal briquette perfection. I have had better food at a hospital cafeteria, much better. If you are reading this before you enter, save yoir hard earned $

They hosted #wvfn, West Valley Friday Nights. We are a group of Twitter folks who try out resturants every friday night, and just love to socialize offline with one another.  We have a about 20 people there. They had great boneless wings, treated us right!  I discovered their 1/2 off domestic & well drinks as well as their 1/2 off appitizers last until 9pm even on Friday. Best and longest happy hour prices in the west valley.   A must stop and check out.

I wished I never came. The saddest part was, I already spent my money there. This place got the worst service you could ever get. They don't ask for a tip, they actually steal it from you. Not only that, long waits and sub-par food (McFadden's Mac&Cheese and Chicken Caesar). Avoid this place at any cause.

Stopped by for lunch on a quiet Saturday. Our server was quick and helpful with menu questions. The food was delivered in a timely manner and warm. Had a Rueben sanwich and fries. The sandwich had potential with thick slices of corned beef inside. The beef was very tenderbut it was lacking flavor and therefore the sandwich flopped.   My lunch companion had a chicken sandwich that was also unremarkable. The fries were pretty good.   The beer was tasty and service was good. Sorry to say it was not worth the trip.

Your employees are by far the rudest of any business establishment I have ever been to in my entire LIFE. Major attitude adjustment needed! P.S your bathrooms smell like shit right next to your kitchen. Not a good look.

Horrible service and junk food. The staff has been poorly trained or management doesn't care this place will go out of business very soon. Our whole group went after work and didn't have anyone even ask if we wanted drinks for 30 minutes after our arrival. Party of 16!

Awesome place! Did St. Patty's and it was amazing. My only issue is because it was an event they have a cover at the door. We bought a lot of food and drinks, so adding a cover bothered me a little. Other than that it is amazing! I would recommend this place if you are in town.

For a place that should be accustomed to dealing with large crowds waiting to get into the nearby arena and stadium, this place is a mess. We tried to get seated for dinner approximately an hour and a half before a concert at the University of Phoenix Stadium. The hostess told us the wait was over an hour so we went to the bar instead. As we stood there, we discovered that the majority of the tables in the restaurant were dirty and not being bussed as the restaurant appeared to be badly understaffed.  Later, as we stood at the bar, we asked the bartender if we could order food there. We were told we could only order food if we were seated. We then asked if we could drag chairs to some empty space at the bar. We were told this was not possible as the space was supposed to be left open. Within five minutes, we watched another guest drag over a chair and sit in the space and the bartender said nothing.  This place is a mess.  Don't even waste your time.  I can't imagine how, in this location, you would not have proper staff to accommodate a large crowd for an event that was announced over four months in advance.  There is another review below that puts this perfectly into context: at any other location, this place would already be out of business.

Ugh...I absolutely hate this place. Not only do the bartenders dress and look like skanks, but their service is terrible. The security guys are extremely rude. Unfortunately, places are limited ta Westgate so I have been here numerous and each time, there is always something wrong. We were there for an hour, my friend literally tripped and almost fell and we were told that we have to calm down otherwise we will get kicked out, as we were all sitting and talking (at 10:00). Sucky place, go somewhere else!

We walked in and sat in the bar - we waited a few minutes to be greeted - but then came Morgan! She was amazing - she was upbeat and so sweet! She took our drink order and our food order and repeated it back - everything you want your server to do! Amazing experience and we will be back!!! Food was good -   but Morgan made it memorable!!!

Well, after reading the reviews I got worried.. Had a $25.00 Groupon coupon so figured we would try it. Dinner started out ok..  We ordered our food. Burgers and chicken wrap.  Food was ok. Burger seemed to be a prepatty?  Well then it got interesting.  Online menu shows burgers $10. Paper menu shows $11.00 Bill came up as $12.00???  Watch your bill.. seems fishy to me..  Asked waitress about it, no kidding she asks me.... "Would u like me to take that off?"  And then we only ordered one soda, ran up as two.. Asked server about it and she said to get the $25 off the bill had to be $50.00 so she just added the 2nd drink on???  So I asked to have the $2.00 off for the Over priced burgers & $3 for the soda.. and I ordered dessert to go to allow bill to be $50.   She brought bill back still with the extra Soda. I asked her about the extra $3..  No kidding she asks again.... "Would you like for me to take that off"  Wow... this was crazy...
Not a Seahawks bar as advertised. Total Dallas.  Service good, food fair prices fair. Tv's small except at Bar.  Tv's change channels randomly

DO NOT USE A CREDIT CARD HERE!. I took a friend out for her birthday and we got some drinks here. A few days latter my credit card company said someone used my card in TX and in Las Vegas and maxed out my card. My company refunded the fraud purchases. Then most recently some friends and I decided to go there before a concert. I told them if you have cash use that and not your card do to the issue I had. They ended up using their card and 4 days latter someone was trying to use their card in Mexico. Someone there is stealing credit card numbers. We will never come back here.

We stopped by here prior to The Who concert to get a couple of drinks and a bite to eat. The place wasn't to busy yet so we thought it would be perfect being so close to the arena. We were seated outside and asked about drink specials, which we were told there were no specials despite the sign hanging right by us stating otherwise. The hostess came and took the sign down...classy. We ordered some appetizers consisting of hot wings, which were not hot and they could not split favors. That was beyond them to do that. The wings were deep fried to the point of being dried and taking on a jerky like consistency. We also ordered some onion rings, which ran $10 for a plate. These were not your hand battered good onion rings-they were straight from the bag frozen and done in two seconds. The ranch dressing served with the wings and rings was about as thick as water and didn't taste much better.   We decided to order a couple of sandwiches, which we figured would be a huge mistake but we were hungry. My wife ordered a club in "Texas toast" and I ordered a half pound bacon and blue burger. I kid you not the order came out as soon as the waitress put it in. There is no way this was cooked to order. The menu said burgers are cooked medium, mine was super well done with no hint of juice. I have no idea at what point the meat weighed half a pound because the "meat" I got was something McDonalds wouldn't serve. My wife's Texas toast was nothing more than regular dry toast. Pints of beer are no cheaper here than inside the arena. The bottom line....go somewhere else when going to an event here or go inside and eat. There's no pride in the cafeteria food they serve. I can only think that they stay in business since on event days they are bound to get a few suckers in there that haven't tried it before. It's to bad having a great spot and all. The valley is loaded with fantastic Irish pubs and this joint should be embarrassed to even consider themselves one. I hope one day this spot is taken over by someone who actually takes pride in what they serve, even on the busiest of days. A busy event should not be an excuse to serve garbage.
Pros: it's close to the stadium, plenty of seating , nice servers, food is okay. Cons: little pricy and food is okay.

Would give NO star if it were an option. What a disappointment. I traveled 100 miles to surprise my wife who is caring for relatives in the Phx area. After shopping at  a nearby outlet mall in the area, we chose McFadden's for lunch.  We had received a coupon book at the mall that had a discount at McFadden's. I should have checked yelp first. The waitress met us at the door and told us that some of the items had been deleted or altered (chicken instead of beef on their Philly Cheese Steak????) the menu has been changed but they have not come back from the printer. A very limited menu and not very cheap either. Our burgers were obviously frozen preformed patties, like you would get at Costco. Good thing it had bacon and bleu cheese, because the patty had NO flavor at all. To top it all off. The waitress would not honor the coupon. Apparently they are null and void on game days. (NHL Coyotes next door) Won't be going back to this dive again.

Prepaid to attend the StPattys day party, got there and was enjoy the evening with my friends. Then I was in line for the restroom and a manager came over and redirected the men's room line down a hall way and told us if we didn't want to wait we could go outside to the porta Johns and then come right back in. So when I got back in line a bouncer came running over saying I wasn't allowed back in, then refused to say why or get the manager to explain why he wouldn't let me back in. I wasn't drunk, belligerent, or rude to anyone. Was there for about 4 hours had less then a handful of beers, ate food. Just feel it was chicken move to refuse re-entry without a reason. Maybe the management should grow a set and be willing to explain themselves!

The food here was pretty good, but the service was not very good.  We waited quite a while for every step of our order even though the place was dead.  It may make more sense to put everyone closer to the kitchen to speed up the process.

DO NOT ENTER DONT DO IT!!!!!!! I had written a review about a year ago and somehow it got deleted.  But the first time I had been there was the worst experience I have ever had an establishment. I said I would never go back, so after a long time I finally decided to give it another shot thinking ok hopefully after reading all these bad reviews they have stepped it up. We'll unfortunately things have gone from bad to Omg someone needs to close this place down.  Disgusting environment.  Nasty girls with dirty shoes dancing on the same bar where they are serving drinks and food.  The girl who works there as an overweight gogo dancer actually took her shirt off. Not what everyone wanted to see. Letting napkins fly through the air and sop up all the nasty on the floor is a disaster for shoes as when many people walked out had napkins stuck to them.  I just don't understand how the hell the health department hasn't been alerted. I think a call will definitely be made. For such a great location I would expect higher quality than this disgusting excuse of a so called club,bar, restaurant. I highly recommend you stay away.

I could go into detail as many have about the multiple terrible experiences encountered here, but to keep it as accurate and short.. EVERY ASPECT OF THIS ESTABLISHMENT IS TRASH.   If yelp had a negative rating this place would not be 1.5 rated, but more like -4 star rated.

Awful food, awful service, dingy atmosphere.  The only reason we stayed is we had a restaurant.com gift card for it.  The prices are pretty high for terrible food and they couldn't get the order right and it was just nachos and a burger!  If you're gonna pay that much go o to yard house instead!

Well, I had been warned by many people not to come here, as it seems the yelp reviews match what I've been told. So I go on a saturday night for a "night out".   In what world is this an irish bar? Tip: turn it into a mexican party bar and you'll do much better. However I fear the the health of the patrons here. But I'll get to that in a minute.  1) wait wait, $5 cover here while no cover at saddle ranch -which has way better service? HA!   2) service was absolutely horrendous. Yes, the bar was crowded on a saturday night, but I'm not a noob to the club scene. It shouldn't take standing at the bar for 10 minutes to get a drink when you're not 3 people deep. I've never seen so many workers behind a bar with such slow service. Everyone looking like they're working but nothing really getting done. Too many bar backs?  3) Here's the most troubling. I saw at least one bar tender scooping ice with a glass. Um, are you retarded? How do you have a job as a bar tender? This is one of the biggest no nos as a bar tender. Hope you like glass shards in your drinks!   Definitely won't be back.  Oh and it looks like many of the TGIF restaurants in the valley are turning into Mcfaddens. Not that I went to TGIF in the first place, but definitely won't anyway.
Really not that good , Food is boring especially for the price , Mix drinks are fair but kind of small .  Service was ok but it was not busy at all .

Terrible place to go. On a busy night they will 86 someone because they don't like them. The manager will not come talk to you if you have an issue. If you voice any type of complaints, they 86 you. This is the 3rd time I've seen someone get kicked out for absolutely no reason. If you're looking for over priced drinks with terrible food selection, you've found your place. A little bouncer named Patrick bounced me because I didn't like how he talked to me. He's the worst type of bouncer, a chicken s$i@ coward that uses 20 bouncers to defend his honor. Lol. Very pissed with this place. Please avoid and save yourself some misery. The customer does not come first.

Literally the shittiest bar in Westgate. They kicked my friend out because he "tipped the bathroom attendant too much" and when I asked them to explain why that was a reason to kick someone out, they told me I was being too aggressive and "called the cops." Fuck them. These bouncers are the dumbest pieces of shit I've ever met.

This place doesn't even deserve a star. I've given this place three trys and every time I've been let down. You'll wait forever to get your drink and then it's not always what you order. I hate writing bad reviews but this place really irritated me. This last time really pushed me over the limit to write this review. My girlfriend and a few others wanted to go here lastnight so I went as well. We were there for about ten minutes and I was about halfway done with my drink when a bouncer approached my girlfriend. He told her she had to go and that she couldn't pull one over on him. She asked what he was talking about and he said that she had already been kicked out for the night. We told the guy we just got there and it  must have been someone else. He told us that we were not going to discuss the matter and to leave. I was shocked and didn't show any signs of frustration but boy was my blood boiling. It was our first stop of the night and it was not how I anticipated it to go. Definitely never going back!
Would give it a zero these pos wouldn't let my friend in just cause he's got face tattoos fck this place don't go there crappy food crappy drinks and shitty management

Is there a way to give this place a half a star?, because that's what it deserves. This place sucks there staff is horrible almost like the girl hates her job and the food was not only cold but horrible. Monday night and there's only 3 tables here and we order cheese sticks and while waiting we then order our food and everything comes out at the same time over 45mins later come on now on a Monday night and cheese sticks ur telling me cheese sticks take 45mins when there's nobody in this place on a Monday night this place sucks and I will never come back and never reccommend it. We ordered the cheese sticks which took over 45mins to come out, I'm sorry but they take what 3 mins tops, the chicken nachos which the chicken was cold and almost like it was pre packaged and taken right out of the package from the fridge to the plate and the cheese wiz was cold as well and the sliders, which the sliders were great only good thing we ordered. I won't be back.

This place is a dump. The place is just a train wreck. The only saving grace is Amber, one of the servers.   We started at the bar, waiting for friends in a concert that that we didn't want to attend, we had some time to kill. The bartenders were not interested in us or our desire to drink. Bathrooms are just disturbing. But we went outside and had server Amber and she was fast and friendly. Food though, terrible

If I could leave 0 stars i would. Came here to watch ufc 202. They tried to charge $50 for a table. We sat outside for free. It got rained on and we had to stand inside to watch. Food ans service were both bad. Wouldn't ever come back. The tv stopped worming while  the fight was on too

It the worst bar ever.  I'm With the band Los Lobos. And security let us in and after 35 minutes a little security guy came and ripped the sun glasses off Cesar Rosas and got there manager Armando Tavares in a choke Hold for no reason.  They refused to give him his credit card back till he called the police. And all of a sudden they found it. We will never go back to this bar Or town no matter how much they pay us!!!

The experience started out great.  I saw they had philly cheesesteak nachos and I had to try them.  Order the large portion if you have more than two people.  There was plenty of cheese.  They even used Cheese Whiz like a true Philly sandwhich.  There was plenty of cheese, but very little meat.  After eating off the top few chips the meat was gone.  They really need to double the meat.  For dinner I attempted to order the BLT, but they were out of bacon.  I settled for the chicken strips.  It was your standard issue chicken strip meal.  Not bad, but I could do the same on my own from the frozen food section at any grocery store.  Our server was nice, and attentive.  That was easy though because the place was nearly empty.

doesn't deserve a star. Food was awful, screwed up all for orders ! How do you do that! lipstick on 2 glasses. No specials for hockey games , only football so its expensive. Do yourself a favor . Smuggle a cocktail into mcdonalds  and drink it with your mcnuggets off the value menu. It will be a much better experience than here and you wont leave feeling like you've robbed.

Could be the worst bar I have ever been to.  The music is terrible, the service is awful and unfriendly.  I get the feeling that the staff here hates their job.    I wish I could nominate McFadden's for the worst of Yelp!  I don't think this place would even still be in business if it weren't in such a busy area.

I only go there at night to PArtay! Haha. They keep the place moving and as much as their rules can be annoying, Im glad they have something in place to keep ppl in check. I like their one DJ-Tyger, he's the best and he's from 98.3 if you ever wanna hear him before going out. I wouldnt recommend to eat dinner here and their pretty pricey but this is def a good place to go to have a good time!
Here for the first time and reading the yelps scared me! I ran to the atm lol. My service has  been good.. Ordered wings and fries they were decent... Drinks are so so... The crowd is ok so far...

BEWARE OF CREDIT CARD FRAUD  This place is currently under investigation. Check out ABC15 news.  It's pretty much a "nightclub" masquerading as a restaurant. I use the word night club loosely. The last time I went I was eaten alive by flying biting insects where the staff really didn't care. If you just want to go and get drunk and possibly catch an STD then this is the place if not go somewhere else.
Bar review only.  We stopped by to have a few drinks before a concert. The service was slow, but the bartender was always nice when she came over to get our next drinks.

I love the food here!!. As a former employee, I still come to mcfaddens for their great food. the servers are awesome, and do a great job at accomdating customers. The chicken nachos are awesome as the rest of the menu is!. I surely will reccomend this restaurant to my friends.

Just want to start off by saying, the bartenders here are amazing and they honestly make this place! They are the ONLY reason why I ever go back! McFaddens has piss poor management and is turning into such a trashy bar! The women's restroom is an absolute embarrassment! Toilet paper rolls on the back of a toilet? Really? The bathrooms are so dirty and literally all the stalls have either a broken lock, no purse hook (I refuse to set my purse on a bathroom floor so yes, it's a big deal to me) or no toilet paper....    Besides the bathroom issue, they also have bottle beer that has a metal taste from being in a metal cooler, or beer trough. They obviously don't rotate their beer in coolers. The whole restaurant is dirty, and I'd never eat here.

Congratulations McFadden's you've done it! You've earned the distinction of worst bar in Arizona. From the dirty(not in a good way) dance floor, awful, negligent(too busy drinking instead of serving) staff, horrible food and the audacity to charge a cover?!? Really, just please make the world a better place and close already. Sincerely, Every Arizona Resident.

Really a bad Irish bar. How long should you sit with an empty beer with 6 bartenders and 12 customers?  They should be busy on St Practice day but I understand why they were not.   They were geared up for business, except they had bad staff.   I walked over to the Yard  House where the place was packed and I received a beer in minutes. They were appropriately staffed, but they can effectively produce quality service with a lower staff ratio.

Overall this place is awful and a place no one should go on purpose. By awful I mean the security always has a bad attitude, the place is always a mess and the layout for the dance floor doesn't make very much sense. Its a dive without dive prices. The only selling points is there VIP program which gives good discounts and makes it a good place to invite people since theres no cover with it.   Sadly its the best place to go in the Westgate complex, but if you have somewhere else to go. Go there.

If it was possible to give negative ratings this would be the place to get them. Food is below average, service sucks. I have been twice.. I thought maybe the first go round was a fluke, but it's the normal thing here. Currently disputing charges on my debit card from 4 days ago, because charging me for shitty food is ok, but charging me twice is just not right. The only thing this bar has to offer is a clean restroom, and the beer was very cold. Every other aspect of this place is just another reason that it should be leveled and something worth wild be put in it's place. McFaddens... should be called McFuckedup.

Don't use you're credit card here. I also had my credit card info stolen here. Even better don't go here at all. Terrible service, horrible food. Every other place in Westgate is way better than this one. I would give zero stars if I could.

Ok let's start with the pro's, the place is fun good music, and is a 49ers sports bar which we love.  The Con's, food menu is small not a lot to choose from and a little over priced for what it is but besides the food this bar is the dirtiest bar I have ever been too, sticky disgusting floor, trash everywhere, the bathrooms are completely tore up, messy not stocked. Also service is slow, and make sure to look at your receipt lots of errors, and the waitresses are not to sure about anything.

The food is typical pub fair. The fries were a little underwhelming. The beer is cold and our favorites were on tap.  The turkey chipotle wrap was pretty spicy. My medium ordered burger came out medium rare. But the location is killer and sitting on the patio is awesome.

Wanted to grab a drink after a coyotes game on the patio, hostess said about 10 min wait for a table on the patio so after getting sat we waited 10 more mins and finally asked a server to get ours so we could place our order, 4 mins later she says she'll be right with us and the proceeds to help 2 tables (6 top and 4 top) that were sat after us so I went inside and got our beers from the bar when I come back she still hasn't even tried to serve us and about 4-7 min later comes back saying it's a server section so if we are sitting on the patio w bar beers we need to move so we asked for a manager and she shockingly never brought him to us. Horrible service
Without doubt the worst service I've ever had. 25 minutes for us to even be acknowledged after being sat. Another 25 for 2 waters.

A friend and I went to McFadden's before a recent Coyote game. The place was dead and I now know why. We were seated out on the patio and waited over 10 minutes before our order was taken. We ordered a beer, a glass of wine and an order of nachos. The nachos arrived after about 20 minutes. Our drinks were another 5 minutes after that. The nachos were horrible.  We would have ordered another round of drinks, but did not want to wait another half hour. Poor service + poor quality food =  A bad experience..
We have come here a few times for bike night and we have always had great food and service! Must try the spicy garlic chicken wings!!!

I ordered a chicken penne. When I received it and half way through eating it I wasn't sure if it was supposed to have chicken in it or not. Sure enough when I got my bill it was a chicken penne. Seeing how I already ate I couldn't really dispute there was no chicken in the chicken penne. How do you screw up something like that? That's like a cheeseburger without the beef patty. Yeah a chicken penne without chicken is totally worth the $15. McFadden's, your food sucks. I can make a much better chicken penne you know why? I actually put chicken in it you lazy bums. I overheard your waiters talk about having bad tips. Maybe the crappy service and forgetting ingredients has something to do with it?

My boyfriend and I will NOT be returning here. We decided to stop in for dinner before a Coyotes game. Our waitress was more concerned with the tables full of older men and their fat wallets than ours, even though we had arrived first and were polite. My boyfriend asked if they had Oktoberfest for their seasonal beer and the waitress responded "No" without offering up any alternatives. We finally got our food (which was really good!) and we ate for a good 20 minutes. In this time my boyfriend finished his beer and was never asked if he wanted another. We were both finished with our food, no sign of our waitress, no follow up on food quality. We waited and waited and she finally decided to show up and we asked for the bill. We have her a card and when she brought it back, the bill included an 18% gratuity. I consider myself a pretty fair person, and if I had seen the mandatory gratuity listed on their menu or had been notified beforehand, then so be it. This came as a shock to both of us and best believe the service we received was in no way deserving of 18% gratuity. Monica needs some training on how to properly wait tables and should take lessons from the other servers in the restaurant. We saw the other servers surrounding our table more often than we saw our own server. Train your employees so you don't lose business.

The drinks are great and staff is friendly but the DJ only plays Spanish music... so if you're not Hispanic it's meh. - I'm updating this review and adding a star because I've been back a few times since, and the DJs have been so much better. Esp last weekend bc they had Jermaine Dupri!

Visited this place the weekend before the BCS.  The beer selection was pathetic, just the big name breweries, come on people!!  Also the server thought IPA was a brand name of a beer.  We got our appetizers on the happy hour menu so the price was right, the chicken fingers were good, and the nachos were average.  We tried to watch the Cotton Bowl, but you couldn't hear the game for the music.  Make up your mind, are you a dance club or a sports bar. The fact that you are next to two stadiums should give you a clue.  The service was also very slow.  When people showed up in the reserved area, our server went MIA.

The kitchen seems to run fine but the wait and bar staff are in serious need of training and management.  It is nearly impossible to get a server to come to your table.  Typically, you have to get up and walk over to where they all stand and do nothing to get their attention.  They serve blue moon without oranges, Dos Equis without lime, fries with no napkins, salt, or ketchup.  And the finale is that they bring you your credit card receipt without a pen so sign the tab.  The waitress will bring you a $5 beer, and if you hand her a $10 she will ask you whether you need change!  The prices are horrible, the service is lousy and the only good news is that this place won't be around long unless they hire a manager to run the place.  It's overstaffed, yet nobody is working.

Came here with my family as they were in town and we wanted to explore Westgate a bit more. We chose to come to McFaddens because we believed we had a gift card and figured we'd give it a shot. It was a Saturday at 7pm and as empty as could be. We sat down and ordered our drinks which came out, my step mom ordered a vodka tonic and it came out without carbonation. She politely asked the server for another as this was just a vodka water and she ordered a tonic and they did, brought her out something that tasted the exact same, no carbonation! We finally got to ordering and the food was ok at best. I enjoyed the flavor of my pulled Pork sliders but nobody else at the table (4 others) even finished their plate, and before we had even gotten to our car my boyfriend and I had already begun to feel sick. The service was ok at best. We had a waitress who was new and that was totally ok! She did well, but throughout our time there we were served by 3 different people and all very bland. The only positive is that they have tvs and we were able to at least catch the end of the Warriors/thunder game.

First of all, let me apologize to the authors of half these reviews for actually thinking McFadden's primary function was a restaurant. That's just what they do to get by during the day, and you're damned right they are far from the best at it. Where this place shines is as a bar.  As a bar, this place is pretty two faced. It has an amazing happy hour. I've waltzed in with a few friends and received great service, from bartenders who gave great recommendations and were generally very amiable. It felt like one of those warm, 'hole-in-the-wall' bars where you could just chill and have a great time.  McFadden's does have a wild side. Late at night it is a full blown club. Lots of security is there to check the line at the door. Scantily-clad women (hoes) are paid to dance with their ass cheeks out on the bar, or pump you a draft from a keg. Not my scene, but if it's yours then you'll love it. It has a way of being a little bit skanky, but not sleazy or full of creeps.  As for the security, they (especially the head of it) are really cool guys. Don't throw a hissy fit when they ask you to take of your hat/sunglasses, and you'll be just fine. Overall this is a good place I enjoy chilling in when I have money to burn.

If I could have rated NO STARS I would have.  When we walked in the hostess' are cleaning the menus and rolling napkins(didnt think this was the appropiate place for that).  Asked for a kids menu, they couldnt find them, said would look some more and bring it to the table.  She never came back, had to ask our server, she said she was looking for it. Mean while shes hugging her friends when they come in the door, almost groping lol.  So she walks by I say , hows that kids menu coming? Oh we ran out.  We get out apps, onion rings and irish nachos.  Cold stale fries onion rings barely warm.  I dont send food back because I heard what they do on comebacks at some places.  Get our food, wife had corned beef and cabbage, the cabbage was spoiled , absolutely tasted so bad.  I had shephards pie, came out luke warm, not very good at all. Mother had a cheeseburger. Came out well done and cold. I bought a groupon for this place and wanted my 25 bucks that spend on that back. The hostess sucked the waitress sucked the food sucked. The manager ended up taking care of our bill. But I still had to pay 25 bucks for shiite ! Stay away from this place.

This was so disappointing. The food selection was horrible and the atmosphere was trashy teenage slash young college kid douches and hoes. Not a cool place to go and relax or have a hyped night out with friends. Just bad all the way around.

Wow.  I'm reading other reviews and I am shocked.  I guess if I knew beforehand, I probably would not have patronized this place.  But I will admit I only went there before the Rams/Cards game because it seemed like they least busy place.  I walked in and was told I could sit in the patio area, where the other games were on TV's.  Aside from them allowing smoking in the patio area where people are eating, I found this place to be okay.  My fish and chips were good and my waitress was very sweet.  The band was playing and everyone was in a pretty good mood in the plaza area.  Maybe I got lucky and found this place on a good day.  No theft here, used cash.
Holy smokes. If your here for drinks, and to get saucey- then go on in. Dont mind girl dancing on the bar above your head. BUT- Do NOT eat the food!! :-/

This restaurant was by far the worst dining experience I've ever had in all aspects. I'm an extremely easygoing customer and I usually like to make friends wherever I go - I'm not a complainer at all. My experience at this restaurant was extremely awful. We were seated for about 15 minutes and no one came to take our drink order, so we had to go seek a server. They said they would have someone come over, but after another 10 minutes I went to find a server again, when finally someone came to take our order. We asked for waters about four times but didn't receive them until we expressed frustration about not receiving waters. We asked for our appetizers first because we were starving but got them out with our meals. They only gave us one of our appetizers and one of my friends didn't even get her meal. We ordered shots and one of them came in a disgusting glass - there was a lipstick stain on one side and I'm pretty sure there was ketchup on the other side. We finally asked to speak to a manager, who came over and listened to our frustrations. He said my friend's entree would be comped and that they would get her a fresh shot. He did not seem apologetic at all or like he was in the wrong at all. If I were the GM of a restaurant I would be so embarrassed about the kind of experience we had. We told him we didn't even want the other appetizer because we were over it, but he brought it out anyway. The food was actually horrible but we were too hungry to care, and the descriptions on the menu did NOT accurately represent what came out. So the tab came and he didn't take anything off - not even the second appetizer that we told him we didn't want anymore. We expected something to be comped, at least our shots. We had to get the bill rectified because he didn't take the entree off that he said he would. My friend also looked at her bank statement the next day and they charged her twice. This was actually the worst dining experience I've ever had.

So the Irish bar that turns into the Hispanic club at night.  My bar seat was taken while I was watching he hockey game. I was told it was for precautionary reasons ...... OMG. It's amazing. All I wanted was shepherds pie and Guinness. Not a chance at this dump.

Depressing. Not a good sign. Completely dead on a Saturday night in the middle of Westgate. I get that there are a couple of other choices in westgate but we decided to pop in here. BIG mistake. Their menu is the typical Irish bar fare,  greasy and should've been perfect after a day of drinking. Unfortunately, this was not the case. All we wanted were pretzels. Seeing they had it on their HH menu we assumed we could just order the more expensive plate not at the discounted HH rate. Ummm, no. They won't serve anything that's on their HH menu unless it's HH. The service was poor-my friend preferred to compare them to a smelly bottom body part. We asked them what beer they had on tap and were told "we have a lot, do you want them to name them ALL?" Huh? I'm sorry that we came into your life and inconvenienced you seeing that your only purpose to be in front of us is to serve us and make sure we have a positive experience in your establishment. Clearly, that was too much to ask for at McFaddens. I've never had such a poor experience in my life.   The food was mediocre and the bathrooms were disgusting.   Maybe, this space is cursed. The Other place that was here shut down too.   Seeing all the reviews on here and being at a 1.5 stars should be a sign. Shut your doors and close up all ready.

A table of 18 and a fairly empty restaurant with an over hour wait for food. Its ridiculous, and as our food arrives its overcooked, no condiments, and no food reprieve for the others at the table still waiting. No apologies, no checking in with us. RIDICULOUS!

Terrible all around. Totally doing construction and remodeling and I should have run for the door when I saw only 2 people were in the bar. Had a restaurants.com certificate to use for this place specifically so we went. Decided on steak and shrimp and guess what, no steak available. Waitress suggested fish and chips so I went with it. It wasn't actually that bad despite being a bit soggy, fries were crispy and good tasting. My friend ordered a chicken cheese crisp and some wings. Tried the pineapple habanero wings and these were not too bad also. Ordered a Sheppard's Pie to go. HORRIBLE. Looked like a hamburger fell on the floor and picked up some remnants. Waitress was friendly and did a good job apologizing for her lame manager who made a lame attempt to apologize for not having food and the noise. Then the bill came and I tried to pay and what a surprise "because we gave you 2 $ off the wings and cheese crisp we can't honor a 25$ discount coupon." I had already had enough of this place and the waitress again was nice about it. This is the last place anyone should try in Westgate and I promise never to go back again! There are so many other places to spend your money in Westgate!

This place needs an overhaul.  I hadn't been here ever - and now I know why I avoided it.  D-bag bartenders.  Over-inflated drink prices for underpoured glasses.  Food that looked pitiful.  Mismatched bar stools. A "buffet" that looked like it had been there all day on a Saturday.  Do yourself a favor, avoid this place.  Ya know unless you enjoy a bartender that shouts "Kobe!!" as he tosses things into receptacles and encourages napkins to be thrown like confetti all over the floor.  Never again.

Not impressed with the food and customer service. The prices were high but didn't match in quality. I ordered the Mongolian flavored wings for an app. The flavor was ok but the chicken was dried out. I ordered the fish and chips with regular fries which ended up being a $4 up charge?! I thought fish and chips was fish and fries?! The F&C totaled $17. I could only handle 2-3 bites of the fish and couldn't do all the breading. It was about 15% fish and 85% breading. I ordered the F&C because the server said it was his favorite and recommended it. My fault for taking his word. I was hoping he might comp at least 50% of it but no such luck. Also, we didn't get a refill until we were about to leave. We will never be going back there, even with a coupon/gift certificate.
cool Irish pub.  Server was very friendly.  Busy during bike night.

First and foremost, McFadden's is not an Irish pub.  Also, just judging by the location and the decor of the place, I would expect the food and service to be about the same as any TGIFs or Applebees or some other generic restaurant/bar establishment.  As a bar/nightclub, however, McFadden's is alright.  The DJ played a typical set of music for a mostly young/white crowd, but he could actually beat-match songs suggesting he has more experience than an iPod on shuffle.  The beer selection is nothing special, and the drink prices are nothing special.  The servers are nice, and cute, especially when they are dancing on the bar.  There's nothing extraordinary about McFadden's, but the ladies seem to like this place, which means I would like to come back again.

The place itself was...umm okay. Went on a Saturday night and got up to go to the bathroom when walking the security guard pushed me away in the direction of the bathroom instead of telling me. Physical pushed me. Never being there before I did not know where it was. I thought that was completely rude and out of line. Should consider your staff to treat the guests better. Totally asshole. Not going back just because of him.

Went there after a Cardinal football game.  We waited in line for quite some time.  (which I have no problem with as the game let out)  Once we got close the bouncers were very rude to the group 2 in front of us in line.  They were threatening to them.  The next group of three got waved in.  my group of three was told $20.00 cover charge.  I questioned (in a nice tone) the amount of the cover charge.  One of the bouncers very rudely told me thats the price "and if you don't like it get the F out of here and go somewhere else".  I asked why the 3 in front of me got let in for free.  He said "the must of paid online own advance".  I asked how he would know that as he never checked or asked.  The people behind us were watching.  They then left.  We left as well.  We told at least 20 people in line what happened and they left too.   There is too many places in the area to go for no cover and great service.  We eat to the Yard House.  Great times there.  Wish I had read these reviews before hand as I never would have tried.  Its evident that management/owners don't care as no replies to reviews on here of Facebook reviews.  I guess they think they that close to the stadium it doesn't matter.  Need will be here again

Alright, SO this was my first time here since having moved to AZ and I have to say it was pretty fun! It could have just been the people I ended up meeting because I went alone, but I digress, here's my review:  I went on a Friday night, there was no cover for girls, guys were $5 (I only know because I asked) - the place has a small dance floor, an outside patio and plenty of seating! I liked how spacious it was and the setup flowed well!  The music was actually pretty good, steady tunes to dance to and keep the vibe alive. The DJ played to the crowd which is very important! Too often they try to be unique or different and thus end up playing sucky a** music. lol.  I didn't eat here, I just had drinks. The guy bartender made my drink strong, the girl bartender did not so I guess you just have to select who you go to. I had Jack and Coke's that ran about $7 bucks.  The atmosphere was definitely a little more classy feeling than say Calico Jack's down the way, but there were some things about this place that some could call "ghetto". Such as....  By the end of the night there were people dancing on the bar with their shirts off and sweating buckets and some girl basically just wearing underwear/booty shorts. I couldn't tell if she was a GoGo dancer or just a patron who took her skirt off! Bleh!! Also the girls that work here wear skimpy clothes, but I guess don't believe in going to the gym?? I'm all for people being comfortable in their own skin, but if you're hiring people to be half naked at least make sure they're in shape! They jiggled and wiggled all over the place!  NOT cute. lol   The bathrooms had an attendant, but she just seemed to give you soap and paper towels and not do much else as it was kind of a mess. I went into one stall and there was no toilet paper on the roll so I went out and asked her for some. She came over looked under the stalls and handed me a roll that had fallen on the floor!!! I seriously was like hell to the NO! I told her, "I am not using that!" She looked at me like I was being a diva and gave me a fresh roll. lol really?  They stayed open all the way until 2am, but once it was over, it was OVER! We wanted to take a picture before we left prompting a security guard to yell, "take your pictures and get out!" lol it was actually kind of funny.  Anyhow, if you're around check this place out. It might not be your regular thing, but it was fun and worth a shot if you're up for an 'interesting' crowd!

DO NOT GO HERE! If you go on an event night, they charge an each dollar for everything WITHOUT TELLING YOU!! And the manager just shrugged his shoulders. Our waitress kept rolling her eyes at us, not sure why. Her attitude was so unnecessary. Awful experience :(

So normally I do not post rants or negative status but this I have to vent . I went out with my friend and boyfriend  . We were all having a great time and hanging out and decided to go to McFaddens in Glendale .   We were dancing an enjoying ourselves when all of a sudden the bouncers grab Cameron and pull him to the side . After him not coming back after a few min , I went and followed . Next thing we know they kicked him out . For literally no reason , there was absolutely not reason .   I went back to the guy that grabbed him and ask " why did you kick my boyfriend out and his reply was " it doesn't matter , it doesn't matter "   Now how the hell you going to tell me your a legitimate establishment when you can't give a reason for kicking someone out ? I mean he could have said he was too drunk ( if that were the case ) but the guy literally gave me no reason , wtf ? And to top it off Cameron was the lightest person in their , could I say this guy was racially profiling him ? I won't because at the end of the day I think the guy was just a plain ole deuce bag . But this has got to stop people need to learn respect and to communicate . You can't just tell someone to leave because you don't like them ect . If we were loud and bothering people I could understand but literally all Cameron did was have his arms around me as he was talking to me about if ever had a "future daughter ..""  When they pulled him aside .   I am writing this post in hopes that it finds people that will follow in suit in not giving this place business because  they obviously decide who can stay and who cannot , without a valid reason . After leaving I checked yelp and they are rated 1.5 stars , which now I understand why . I also want to add I was sober this whole time , not one drop of alcohol so this isn't some drunken misunderstand

Real classy place let me tell you. Tables are filthy. Paper towels all over the ground. A hand written paper says "this area is for bottle service only" and of course no one is in there. Cover charge at this place?? You know they are dying. Jon Taffer needs to come in and over haul this place if they ever want customers again. It's very ghetto so stay away if you are looking for safety!

The service was great don't get me wrong but the food was flat out bad. I tried the hamburger and fries and it was like fast food. I could have gotten a better hamburger at In n' Out. The fries looked like something out of a grocery store frozen bag and they were soggy. I was here going to the Taylor Swift concert and I would recommend any other restaurant in the WestGate area before this place.
One Star is not low enough for this place. Never have I ever been served with such disrespect in my life. The bartenders here at ridiculous. The drinks are weak. I can't believe I even went here.

Dirty, dark, gloomy restaurant. Horrible service. Servers were young girls who only cared about chit chatting among themselves. The food was so-so. They added 20% gratuity for 7 people with TWO separate checks. They didn't deserve even 5%. Let alone the 20%. We went there because we had a coupon. Never going back there again. WOULD NOT recommend it to anyone.

This place is a joke. The food is a joke. The service is a joke. The biggest joke is the security who, in their mind, think they are above all authority. I hear horrible things about this place all the time and I should have never went. I don't understand why there is always a line Friday and Saturday nights. It sucks!

I came here a couple years ago and it was a classy lounge.  So after the opening coyotes game I was excited to go have a couple beers with my husband.  After paying the 5 dollar entery fee for my husband we walked in and immediately walked back out! Napkins all over the floor and what smelled like a toilet all around us we couldn't even attempt to get a drink. It seemed like a pick up joint for low rent hookers.  No wonder the police hang out outside! Disgusting! The place should be closed down.  If I could give it less than 1 star I would!

McFadden's found away to make a novelty out of an Irish pub.  Although they didn't do a very good job as Irish pubs are usually awesome.    The service is OK.  Our waitress was really nice.  We had 3 by the time the night was over.  The food is not terrible and is eatable but if you are looking for something worth the money you will be disappointed.  The portions are fine but a ten dollar burger is just a ten dollar burger.  Flavor was over salty and too much pepper.  The BBQ sauce sugary and the cheese lacked flavor even though it goop-ed off!  The French Fry portion was nothing to write home about either.  A plastic cup of beer (Stella) will set you back 5 bucks for maybe 12 oz.  They do have days with drink specials but I went to one of these and they water down the drinks.  I also went to a party where the drinks were only 1 buck and again it was a weak drink.    Bottom line is this place over priced, over hyped, and over used as a meeting spot.

Overpriced food. Beer in dirty glass. Sewer like smell on the inside. Ordered burger medium rare, came out medium well. My wife thinks she found a hair in her food. No real reason to come here. Go to BWW if you're at westgate.

Never have I been treated so badly. It seems every time I eat here I get treated like I am a bother.  Why have honey hot as an option if I cannot order it. I will not be choosing mcdaddens ever for my future needs.

I had dinner with about 20 women here last night. I would say this place was okay, but there was nothing memorable that would make me want to go back. The service was average. We were a large group and our server seemed to disappear for quite awhile at the end of the evening and forgot to refill drinks, never asked if we wanted dessert, and I had to ask for the bill after we'd been sitting there finished with dinner for about a half hour. The food was good, but again, nothing memorable. I had the Chicken Caesar Wrap with onion rings. It was good and priced well, but not special enough to brag about.

It's Always Cloudy in Glendale  I imagine the imaginary Paddy's Pub would serve better food. As long as Charlie Day isn't at the grill, that is...  The first sign of "Uh-oh" at McFadden's Restaurant and Saloon (2/5 Stars) was the electronic menu outside that was displaying a Windows error in digitally showing said menu. Still, I'd like to give it a shot.  Inside I was floored on how plain it was. Mostly, it looks like a restaurant, but it hints at being a night-club following after (dinner) hours. It wasn't dirty or run down, just mediocre.   After being encouraged to sit at the bar, my friend and I asked for a table. It was a Saturday afternoon and virtually no one was in the place. (Eventually, other patrons came in, but not enough to fill the place. I even quietly joked on the way to the table that the place was too loud...but the hostess heard me. Of course she did.) The waitress was prompt and extremely energetic and enthusiastic, two pluses in my book. She was also patient since this was my buddy and I's first visit.  I ordered the "Classic Burger" since I wasn't hungry, but I love a great burger. (Side Note: Why do they always call it "Classic"? Is that the polite and professional way of saying: you have no real taste in food, so just order the easiest and most clichéd menu item?)
